{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","title":"How to Improve Your Memory","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p> You’re chatting with a friend and want to recommend a good book you just finished, or a movie you finally saw. All of a sudden, you can’t remember the title! It feels like it’s on the tip of your tongue, but the harder you try to remember, the more it eludes you. We’ve all been there, and everyone knows how hard it is to keep track of all of that information floating around in your head. Luckily, there are plenty of options available when it comes to jogging your short-term memory, improving your long-term memory, and tricking your mind into remembering important details. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Memory Help\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Memory-Help\">Memory Help</span></h3> \n <div id=\"sd_container\">\n  <div class=\"sd_thumb\">\n   <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sample/Memory-Tricks\"><img class=\"whcdn\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" data-src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Memory-Tricks.png/340px-Memory-Tricks.png\" id=\"5f7fd93b4c908\" /><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('5f7fd93b4c908')</script>\n    <noscript>\n     <img class=\"whcdn\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Memory-Tricks.png/340px-Memory-Tricks.png\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" />\n    </noscript><span>Memory Tricks</span></a>\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"sd_thumb\">\n   <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sample/Roman-Room\"><img class=\"whcdn\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" data-src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/39/Roman-Room.png/340px-Roman-Room.png\" id=\"5f7fd93b4d76e\" /><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('5f7fd93b4d76e')</script>\n    <noscript>\n     <img class=\"whcdn\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/39/Roman-Room.png/340px-Roman-Room.png\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" />\n    </noscript><span>Sample Roman Room</span></a>\n  </div>\n </div> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Repeat important information out loud.[1]\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Repeat-important-information-out-loud.[1]\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Repeat-important-information-out-loud..5B1.5D\">Repeat important information out loud.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup></span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Say that address, phone number, or date over and over again to commit it to memory.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup> This is an extremely simple solution, but it’s the best option you have if you know you’re going to need a bit of information in the near-future.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Improve-Your-Memory-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Improve Your Memory Step 1 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/48/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>When you repeat something out loud, you aren’t technically memorizing it. You’re actually creating a pattern and sound that will make the info easier to recall in the future.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Create notable associations in your head.[4]\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Create-notable-associations-in-your-head.[4]\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Create-notable-associations-in-your-head..5B4.5D\">Create notable associations in your head.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup></span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Paint a picture in your mind to make names, dates, and objects easier to remember. If you meet someone named Vincent, try picturing them looking at a Vincent Van Gogh painting. If you want to remember that you parked your car on Logan Boulevard, you may imagine Wolverine from <i>X-Men</i> sitting in your back seat.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup> Doing this in your head can dramatically improve your ability to recall specific information, and it can be a fun exercise as well!\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Improve-Your-Memory-Step-2-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Improve Your Memory Step 2 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4f/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-2-Version-5.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-2-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For another example, if you’re bad with names and you meet someone named Evelynn, you might think, “Christmas Eve” and picture this person dressed as Santa. If you find a brand of potato chips you like, called “Umbrella Chips,” you may picture a stack of spuds sitting on a beach under a parasol.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Focus on one thing at a time.[7]\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Focus-on-one-thing-at-a-time.[7]\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Focus-on-one-thing-at-a-time..5B7.5D\">Focus on one thing at a time.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup></span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Turn the TV off while you study and get off of the phone while you’re driving. When you juggle multiple activities, your attention is divided, which will make it hard to process the information necessary to remember what you’re doing. If you want to remember things more clearly, focus on one task at a time. Keep your phone in your pocket, take your headphones off, and aim to dedicate yourself to the task at hand.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Improve-Your-Memory-Step-3-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Improve Your Memory Step 3 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-3-Version-5.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-3-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>There may be a long-term effect of multitasking as well. There’s evidence that people who multitask a lot tend to struggle with distractions more often than others.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Take notes and write things down.[10]\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Take-notes-and-write-things-down.[10]\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Take-notes-and-write-things-down..5B10.5D\">Take notes and write things down.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Write something down if you want to remember it in the future. Taking a note will help you retain the information, even if you never look at your notes again! While memorization takes place entirely in the brain, writing is a physical act. By combining memorization with the act of writing, it helps your brain commit the information to memory.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Improve-Your-Memory-Step-4-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Improve Your Memory Step 4 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f9/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-4-Version-4.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-4-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Oddly enough, research seems to indicate that it’s hard to achieve the same effect by typing something on your phone or laptop, so you’re better off sticking to pen and paper if you really want to remember your friend’s birthday or next week’s dentist appointment.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Take a short walk.[13]\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Take-a-short-walk.[13]\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Take-a-short-walk..5B13.5D\">Take a short walk.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup></span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>There’s a lot of scientific evidence that taking a walk will jog your memory.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup> If you’re trying to remember something, spend a few minutes walking around your neighborhood to see if it helps. At worst, you’ll get some exercise and relax a little. At best, you’ll remember the name of that life-changing book from grade school!\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Improve-Your-Memory-Step-5-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Improve Your Memory Step 5 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-5-Version-4.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-5-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you’re short on time, there’s evidence that walking backwards for a few minutes can help you recall specific details.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup> You may feel silly doing it, but it may help you remember something important.</li> \n    <li>Regular walking may help your overall memory as well. Walking a few times a week can literally increase the size of your hippocampus, which is the part of your brain responsible for memory.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup> That’s right—walking can give you big brains!</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Change your routine to memorize important information.[17]\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Change-your-routine-to-memorize-important-information.[17]\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Change-your-routine-to-memorize-important-information..5B17.5D\">Change your routine to memorize important information.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup></span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Stand up to memorize a crucial bit of information or sit outside while you study difficult materials. Lay down or do jumping jacks while reciting something you really want to internalize. Routines are great if you want to establish good habits, but they also make it more likely that you go through the motions without processing what you’re doing. Even something as simple as taking your laptop off of your desk and working at your kitchen table can help you remember what you’re doing in the future.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Improve-Your-Memory-Step-6-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Improve Your Memory Step 6 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-6-Version-4.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-6-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Routines require very little effort or attention. This is why people occasionally forget to stop at a grocery store or post office on their way home from work—they’re just not used to doing it. This is known as procedural memory, where you memorize the routine instead of the material. By changing the procedure, you make easier to form a memory!<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Drink some coffee or tea.[20]\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Drink-some-coffee-or-tea.[20]\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Drink-some-coffee-or-tea..5B20.5D\">Drink some coffee or tea.<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup></span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Try brewing some green tea or drinking a coffee to jog your memory.<sup id=\"_ref-21\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 21\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-21\">[21]</a></sup> The reasoning here is pretty straightforward: caffeine wakes you up, which gives your brain a boost. This can help you remember specific information that’s just on the tip of your tongue.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Improve-Your-Memory-Step-7-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Improve Your Memory Step 7 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ec/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-7-Version-4.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-7-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Caffeine will help you remember things from you past, but it won’t help you form new memories. As a result, drinking a pot of java while you’re studying isn’t a particularly good way to commit the material to memory.<sup id=\"_ref-22\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 22\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-22\">[22]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Cut back on the sweets.[23]\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Cut-back-on-the-sweets.[23]\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Cut-back-on-the-sweets..5B23.5D\">Cut back on the sweets.<sup id=\"_ref-23\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 23\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-23\">[23]</a></sup></span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Eating a lot of sugar is bad for your long-term memory, so avoid sugar to keep your mind clear. Take your coffee with cream and skip the sugar. Try to cut the candy bars and junk food out entirely. Not only will you be healthier and happier, but you’ll have an easier time remembering things.<sup id=\"_ref-24\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 24\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-24\">[24]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Improve-Your-Memory-Step-8-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Improve Your Memory Step 8 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-8-Version-5.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-8-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Eating a high-fat diet will likely have a similar effect, although fat’s impact on memory hasn’t been studied as thoroughly as sugar’s.<sup id=\"_ref-25\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 25\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-25\">[25]</a></sup> Just try to eat a balanced diet and avoid processed foods whenever possible.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Do puzzles and play strategy games.[26]\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Do-puzzles-and-play-strategy-games.[26]\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Do-puzzles-and-play-strategy-games..5B26.5D\">Do puzzles and play strategy games.<sup id=\"_ref-26\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 26\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-26\">[26]</a></sup></span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Play a game of chess, do a crossword puzzle, or gather some friends for a card game. This won’t explicitly help your memory, but they will keep your brain on its toes.<sup id=\"_ref-27\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 27\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-27\">[27]</a></sup> When you play games that require a lot of thinking, it’s kind of like lifting weights for your brain. There’s plenty of evidence that strategy and brain games will improve your cognitive functioning, which can help with memory recall.<sup id=\"_ref-28\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 28\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-28\">[28]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Improve-Your-Memory-Step-9-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Improve Your Memory Step 9 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-9-Version-4.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-9-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>There’s also some research that suggests playing video games can help your memory. Just be careful about overdoing it and try to stick with games that require some complex thinking.<sup id=\"_ref-29\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 29\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-29\">[29]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: Meditate a few times a week.[30]\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Meditate-a-few-times-a-week.[30]\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Meditate-a-few-times-a-week..5B30.5D\">Meditate a few times a week.<sup id=\"_ref-30\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 30\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-30\">[30]</a></sup></span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Meditate regularly if you want to improve your memory over time. By meditating, you bridge that gap between what’s going on in your head and what’s happening in your body.<sup id=\"_ref-31\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 31\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-31\">[31]</a></sup> While you may not see results right away, meditating for 20-30 minutes a day may improve your memory in as little as 1 month.<sup id=\"_ref-32\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 32\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-32\">[32]</a></sup> So find a nice quiet place to relax, sit down, and do some guided meditation to get started.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Improve-Your-Memory-Step-10-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Improve Your Memory Step 10 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3e/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-10-Version-4.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-10-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Even if you don’t feel your memory improving, regular meditation will improve your mental fortitude, emotional well-being, and physical health, so it’s certainly worth a shot. Stick with it!<sup id=\"_ref-33\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 33\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-33\">[33]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13\" title=\"Edit section: Exercise more often.[34]\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Exercise-more-often.[34]\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Exercise-more-often..5B34.5D\">Exercise more often.<sup id=\"_ref-34\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 34\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-34\">[34]</a></sup></span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Go running, bike to work, or lift weights a few times a week. Working out gets the blood pumping through your body, which increases the blood flow to your brain.<sup id=\"_ref-35\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 35\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-35\">[35]</a></sup> Find fun ways to exercise to make it more likely that you stick with it. For example, if lifting weights isn’t your thing, you could play basketball or go swimming at a local pool a few times a week.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Improve-Your-Memory-Step-11-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Improve Your Memory Step 11 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/02/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-11-Version-5.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-11-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>While this won’t help you recall anything in the moment, regular exercise is one of the best ways to gradually improve your ability to remember things.<sup id=\"_ref-36\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 36\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-36\">[36]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14\" title=\"Edit section: Get plenty of sleep every night.[37]\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Get-plenty-of-sleep-every-night.[37]\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Get-plenty-of-sleep-every-night..5B37.5D\">Get plenty of sleep every night.<sup id=\"_ref-37\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 37\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-37\">[37]</a></sup></span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Go to bed at a reasonable time and get 8 hours of sleep a night. If you’re studying for a big test, you’re more likely to get a good grade by snoozing than you would by cramming all night and studying.<sup id=\"_ref-38\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 38\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-38\">[38]</a></sup> Sleeping helps you process large chunks of information, so get at least 8 hours of rest every night if you want to remember things clearly.<sup id=\"_ref-39\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 39\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-39\">[39]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Improve-Your-Memory-Step-12-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Improve Your Memory Step 12 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c5/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-12-Version-4.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-12-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>While the relationship between sleep and memory isn’t entirely understood, it’s suggested that sleep helps you consolidate memories, which is the process where new information is converted into something you can remember.<sup id=\"_ref-40\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 40\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-40\">[40]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=15\" title=\"Edit section: Note those moments where you remember something.[41]\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Note-those-moments-where-you-remember-something.[41]\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Note-those-moments-where-you-remember-something..5B41.5D\">Note those moments where you remember something.<sup id=\"_ref-41\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 41\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-41\">[41]</a></sup></span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Remembering something once makes it easier for your brain to remember it in the future.<sup id=\"_ref-42\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 42\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-42\">[42]</a></sup> Unfortunately, every time you remember something, your brain distorts the facts and details a little, kind of like that telephone game where people whisper a phrase to one another.<sup id=\"_ref-43\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 43\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-43\">[43]</a></sup> To counteract this effect, play things you remember over in your mind and say, “I’m remembering this right now” out loud. This can help you recall the details and specifics the next time you try to remember it.<sup id=\"_ref-44\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 44\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_note-44\">[44]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Improve-Your-Memory-Step-13-Version-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Improve Your Memory Step 13 Version 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-13-Version-5.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-13-Version-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Noticing when you remember things may feel kind of hard at first, but it’ll be easier to do this once you get into the habit of it.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=16\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Add-5-Consecutive-Numbers-Quickly\" title=\"Add 5 Consecutive Numbers Quickly\">Add 5 Consecutive Numbers Quickly</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Express-Yourself\" title=\"Express Yourself\">Express Yourself</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Develop-Emotional-Intelligence\" title=\"Develop Emotional Intelligence\">Develop Emotional Intelligence</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Mind-Power\" title=\"Improve Mind Power\">Improve Mind Power</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Improve-Your-Memory&amp;action=edit&amp;section=17\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span href=\"https://www.health.harvard.edu/topics/improving-memory\">https://www.health.harvard.edu/topics/improving-memory</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-28\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/healthy-aging/in-depth/memory-loss/art-20046518\">https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/healthy-aging/in-depth/memory-loss/art-20046518</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-29\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_ref-29\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://aansneurosurgeon.org/playing-3d-video-games-may-boost-memory-formation/\">https://aansneurosurgeon.org/playing-3d-video-games-may-boost-memory-formation/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-30\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_ref-30\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://greatergood.berkeley.edu/article/item/can_mindfulness_improve_your_bad_memory\">https://greatergood.berkeley.edu/article/item/can_mindfulness_improve_your_bad_memory</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-31\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_ref-31\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.health.harvard.edu/mind-and-mood/meditation-may-help-you-catch-mental-mistakes\">https://www.health.harvard.edu/mind-and-mood/meditation-may-help-you-catch-mental-mistakes</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-32\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_ref-32\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-33\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_ref-33\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.mayoclinic.org/tests-procedures/meditation/in-depth/meditation/art-20045858\">https://www.mayoclinic.org/tests-procedures/meditation/in-depth/meditation/art-20045858</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-35\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_ref-35\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/healthy-aging/in-depth/memory-loss/art-20046518\">https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/healthy-aging/in-depth/memory-loss/art-20046518</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-36\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_ref-36\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer href=\"http://healthysleep.med.harvard.edu/healthy/matters/benefits-of-sleep/learning-memory\">http://healthysleep.med.harvard.edu/healthy/matters/benefits-of-sleep/learning-memory</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-38\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_ref-38\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/healthy-aging/in-depth/memory-loss/art-20046518\">https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/healthy-aging/in-depth/memory-loss/art-20046518</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-39\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_ref-39\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3413705/\">https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3413705/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-40\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_ref-40\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://healthysleep.med.harvard.edu/healthy/matters/benefits-of-sleep/learning-memory\">http://healthysleep.med.harvard.edu/healthy/matters/benefits-of-sleep/learning-memory</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-41\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_ref-41\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.apa.org/science/about/psa/2016/06/learning-memory\">https://www.apa.org/science/about/psa/2016/06/learning-memory</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-42\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_ref-42\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.apa.org/science/about/psa/2016/06/learning-memory\">https://www.apa.org/science/about/psa/2016/06/learning-memory</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-43\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_ref-43\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/topics/social-sciences/memory-retrieval\">https://www.sciencedirect.com/topics/social-sciences/memory-retrieval</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-44\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Memory#_ref-44\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S1053810015001518\">https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S1053810015001518</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 04 Oct 2020 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Memory-Tricks.png/340px-Memory-Tricks.png","linkMd5":"281a03059bc069b457134e74cc339b1a","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn10@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-01-710_1816f33683a3b863.webp","destWidth":340,"destHeight":440,"sourceBytes":14378,"destBytes":7116,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Memory-Tricks.png/340px-Memory-Tricks.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn10@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-01-710_1816f33683a3b863.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/39/Roman-Room.png/340px-Roman-Room.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn65@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-24-247_38bbffb079537b63.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/48/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-1-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn76@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-22-760_f186ea23f14a0a12.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4f/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-2-Version-5.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-2-Version-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn88@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-26-845_9921a52507047f30.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c6/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-3-Version-5.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-3-Version-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn36@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-19-574_f916f237ab98ce84.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f9/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-4-Version-4.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-4-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn64@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-20-278_456e95883d368794.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-5-Version-4.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-5-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn39@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-20-008_c3c37dd73b18e570.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-6-Version-4.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-6-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn77@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-25-866_11fa4473aa9e6496.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ec/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-7-Version-4.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-7-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn95@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-19-014_31c7e6f5b9adaf3e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-8-Version-5.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-8-Version-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn84@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-20-342_2183c3accaa5d643.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-9-Version-4.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-9-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn52@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-20-873_1607eba9483dfe64.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3e/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-10-Version-4.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-10-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn20@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-19-988_00d5bbfbac1fd23a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/02/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-11-Version-5.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-11-Version-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn3@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-28-141_01d1975d5817b7cf.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c5/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-12-Version-4.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-12-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn11@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-21-398_71dd492d98611b31.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/Improve-Your-Memory-Step-13-Version-5.jpg/aid20969-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Memory-Step-13-Version-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn32@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-21-628_bbcb6d44fa8d4ced.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214380989},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","title":"How to Make an Awesome Music Playlist","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Whether you want to take over DJ duties at your next party or create a good mix to listen to while you work out, there are a few tricks of the playlist trade. Picking a theme, sticking with the right amount of songs, and listening to your playlist over and over can help you modify and tweak it to be the best it can be. If you ever feel stuck, try asking your friends for suggestions or looking at popular playlists online to get some inspiration. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Picking a Theme\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Picking-a-Theme\">Picking a Theme</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Try a nostalgic playlist for a throwback vibe. If you want to be transported back to the past, pick a time period where you had the most fun and choose songs that remind you of it. You could pick a time when you grew up, one when you were in school, or just one that reminds you of a good time.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 1 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/32/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try 90’s R&amp;B, early 2000’s pop music, 70’s psychedelic rock, or even 80’s jam bands.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Go for an upbeat playlist for working out. If you want to take your playlist to the gym, think about songs that will pump you up and get you ready for your workout. Try songs that have a fast tempo, a strong beat, and a solid baseline to keep you in workout mode the entire time.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-2-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 2 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3c/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-2-Version-4.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-2-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Dubstep and EDM songs are great ones for working out.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Stick with soothing music for relaxation or meditation. For calming songs that you can listen to while studying, meditating, or winding down, go for slow, soft tempo songs with quiet base lines. You can even pick music that is specifically for meditating with white noise or nature sounds incorporated.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-3-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 3 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/de/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-3-Version-4.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-3-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Classical music is also great for relaxation and studying since it doesn’t have any distracting lyrics.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Lean towards popular music for parties. If you’re taking your playlist to a party or a DJ set, go for songs that most people will know. You don’t have to choose songs that are all from the top 40 list, but try to pick ones that you and your friends all know. The more people can sing along, the more they will dance and jam to the music.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-4-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 4 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-4-Version-4.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-4-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Different parties might need different soundtracks. A kid’s birthday party, for example, will have different music than a house show in your neighborhood.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Base your playlist off your mood for a specific vibe. Some songs can bring up certain emotions, and you can make a whole playlist based on that. If you’re feeling happy, go for uplifting, supportive songs. If you’re feeling a little down, try adding melancholy or sad songs to your playlist.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-5-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 5 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d1/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-5-Version-4.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-5-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This is a great way to figure out a name for your playlist as well, since you can just title it after your mood.</li> \n    <li>Angry playlists might have a lot of heavy metal, content playlists might play smooth jazz, and sad playlists might have classical or slow songs.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Organizing Songs\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Organizing-Songs\">Organizing Songs</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Open up a music program on your phone or computer. There are a few different websites where you can make a playlist. Spotify, Apple Music, Playlist.com, and Windows Media Player all allow you to make specific playlists, so you can choose whichever one you feel most confident with.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-6-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 6 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-6-Version-4.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-6-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Internet radio stations like Pandora allow you to make your own radio station, but they don’t let you compile individual songs into a playlist.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Start with a hook. Whatever your theme, genre, or taste, one thing about playlists is universal: it's got to start with a great song. Lead off with a song that'll hook everyone who'll listen, or will kick off your personal favorites playlist with a bang.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Alternatively, maybe the order of the songs is predetermined (as in a countdown playlist) or maybe you're just not interested in a carefully selected order for the songs. Consider randomizing the order by hitting shuffle, or by tossing the songs in alphabetically for easy access. This tends to be easier for very long playlists.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Include some highs and lows. In most cases, you'll want an awesome playlist to vary the mood, the tempo, and the tones in the music somewhat, or else it'll get repetitive and dull. Even if you're making a Best of Black Metal playlist, try to throw some more atmospheric headbangers in there, or it'll be hard to follow.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 8 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Alternatively, a party playlist should probably only go up, so start with a banger and progressively get rowdier. Likewise, a go-to-sleep playlist should stay relatively sedate. Let it fade off into white noise or silence at the ending.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add a climactic song in the middle of the playlist. Whichever song is the loudest, has the most noise, or is the most interesting is the one you should put in the middle of everything. Think of your playlist like climbing a mountain: the middle is the peak, and then you gradually come back down again.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Depending on the playlist theme, this could be a really fast rap song, a loud EDM song, an orchestral classical piece, or anything in between.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Listen to the transitions between songs. Some songs have abrupt endings while others will have gradual fade-outs or codas. Some rock songs end with long blasts of feedback, while other songs will fade out. Listen to how each song transitions into the next.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/43/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Avoid aural schizophrenia. It's nice to have some variety, but going straight from Slayer to Simon and Garfunkel will sound strange. It's your playlist, but try to make the order relatively smooth. Slayer to Led Zeppelin's \"Since I've Been Loving You\" to Simon and Garfunkel? That's more like it.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Making People-Pleasing Playlists\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Making-People-Pleasing-Playlists\">Making People-Pleasing Playlists</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Aim for 30 to 50 songs total. Playlists that are too short won’t captivate your audience, and ones that are too long can be a little overwhelming. Try to go for 30 to 50 songs total to hit the sweet spot for an awesome playlist.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 11 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b3/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Sticking to this many songs gives you enough time to convey the theme of your playlist without dragging it out too long.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Think about your playlist’s audience. Different people like different music, and some songs may be more appropriate than others. If you’re going to a child’s birthday party, you might pick songs geared towards younger children. If you’re just hanging out with your friends, you could pick popular songs that are on the radio right now.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 12 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/28/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you’re making a playlist for kids, make sure you listen to the lyrics of every song you add to avoid curse words.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Include 1 to 2 songs per artist to avoid repetition. While this rule originally started to protect artists on radio stations, it’s a good rule of thumb to stick to so you and your audience don’t get bored. As you compile your music, try to only add 1 to 2 songs by the same artist throughout the whole playlist.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 13 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9d/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Having too many songs by the same artist can feel too much like just listening to an album.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Name the playlist something eye-catching and relevant. If your playlist is public, people may be able to click on it and play it for themselves. To make it enticing, try to name it something that captures the theme of the playlist and seems snappy and fun.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 14 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, you could try “100 Most Uplifting Songs Ever.”</li> \n    <li>Or, “The World’s Most Perfect Pop Songs.”</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Elevating Your Playlist\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Elevating-Your-Playlist\">Elevating Your Playlist</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Be on the lookout for new music. If you’re trying to make an awesome playlist, you probably listen to a lot of music. As you find new music, save it to your phone or computer so that you can add it to your existing playlist or create a new one in a few months.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-15.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 15.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-15.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-15.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try listening to the radio, other playlists, and your friends’ recommendations.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Update your playlist every few weeks. To keep your playlist fresh, try to update it every 2 weeks or so. You can add new music that you find and delete irrelevant music that you don’t like as much anymore.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-16.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 16.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c3/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-16.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-16.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Updating your playlist too often can confuse your listeners, while leaving it for too long can make it feel stale.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Test out your playlist. You can put your playlist on your phone, iPod, or any other portable music device and take it out with you on a run, or to the gym, or to the party where you want to dance. Delete songs that don't work and add songs that enhance the experience that you're soundtracking. It's easy to make changes.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-17.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 17.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/01/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-17.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-17.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You might decide that some songs fit better elsewhere, in which case you can make a brand new playlist instead.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Make collaborative playlists with your friends. If you’re feeling stuck in a rut or you want to take your playlist to the next level, consider making a playlist where multiple people can add and delete songs. This will take the pressure off of you to be the sole contributor, and it can introduce you to new music that you might not have heard of before.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-18.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make an Awesome Music Playlist Step 18.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0b/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-18.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-18.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can make collaborative playlists on Spotify and Apple Music.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Some applications, such as Spotify, will offer song suggestions for your playlist while you're creating it. This can help you find songs you forgot and songs you didn't know about.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-iTunes\" title=\"Use iTunes\">Use iTunes</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-Spotify\" title=\"Use Spotify\">Use Spotify</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Create-a-New-Playlist-on-YouTube\" title=\"Create a New Playlist on YouTube\">Create a New Playlist on YouTube</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Playlist\" title=\"Make a Playlist\">Make a Playlist</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Export-an-iTunes-Playlist\" title=\"Export an iTunes Playlist\">Export an iTunes Playlist</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Playlist-on-an-iPod\" title=\"Make a Playlist on an iPod\">Make a Playlist on an iPod</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section:
