</li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 04 Oct 2020 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/32/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-1-Version-4.jpg","linkMd5":"7aaba20c7991559cfaa585d3ae26e966","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn35@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-01-908_9d357f34b5622b69.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":83490,"destBytes":45804,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/32/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-1-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn35@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-01-908_9d357f34b5622b69.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3c/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-2-Version-4.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-2-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn51@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-18-057_63cc45a981aa4364.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/de/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-3-Version-4.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-3-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn61@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-18-072_c3c1387b8a9bd643.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-4-Version-4.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-4-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn8@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-19-328_778d72a31f7bd848.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d1/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-5-Version-4.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-5-Version-4.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-6-Version-4.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-6-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn30@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-28-784_ad2458cf11913403.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-7-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn89@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-18-120_3864266063e97e39.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-8-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn50@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-26-499_9c938779d2d6cdff.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-9-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn97@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-26-023_83d8bd3734955ca8.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/43/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn14@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-26-436_35cb690900c567c0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b3/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-11-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn63@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-23-489_3728b5e9a2b67b71.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/28/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-12-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn27@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-28-228_366122c110710c56.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9d/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-13-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn46@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-24-061_24d28ae7d78768c2.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-14-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn32@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-23-279_f4d55c21b0da536e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-15.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-15.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn15@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-19-108_94d07509374e0410.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c3/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-16.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-16.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn87@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-28-501_a61b3f36fc517980.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/01/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-17.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-17.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn12@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-23-095_2ff832ec17e6391b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0b/Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-18.jpg/aid479017-v4-728px-Make-an-Awesome-Music-Playlist-Step-18.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn90@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-26-094_e9907cd72c0c5c7d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214380918},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","title":"How to Cook Stuffed Clams","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Stuffed clams make a delicious seafood dish, and you might think they’re hard to cook. However, while they seem fancy, stuffed clams are very easy to make yourself! All you need are some clams, breadcrumbs, and whatever seasonings you want to add. After a little bit of prep work and baking, you can serve your very own gourmet-looking stuffed clams. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Stuffed-Clams&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Ingredients\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Ingredients\">Ingredients</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>16-24 little neck clams</li> \n  <li>1 cup (237 ml) of white wine</li> \n  <li>2 tbsp (7.2 g) of chopped parsley</li> \n  <li>1 tsp (1 g) of chopped dill</li> \n  <li>1 tsp (1 g) of thyme</li> \n  <li>1/2 tsp (1/2 g) of rosemary</li> \n  <li>Salt</li> \n  <li>Black pepper</li> \n  <li>Olive oil</li> \n  <li>Garlic</li> \n  <li>Red and white onion</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Stuffed-Clams&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Stuffed-Clams&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Cleaning the Clams\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Cleaning-the-Clams\">Cleaning the Clams</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Buy fresh, live clams from a fish market. Look for clams that are tightly-closed and don’t have a strong fishy smell. This means that they're still alive and fresh. You could also ask a worker when the clams were caught and delivered, which should be the same day or the previous day for maximum freshness.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-1.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don’t buy any clams that are already open or cracked. These might be dead and could be spoiled.</li> \n    <li>This recipe uses 16 clams, but you can get as many as you want and adjust the recipe.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Store the clams in the refrigerator until you're ready to cook them. Clams spoil quickly in warm temperatures, so refrigerate them right away when you get home. Keep them in the refrigerator or on ice until you're just about to clean and cook them.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/54/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-2.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Clams only last about 1-2 days after you buy them, even in the refrigerator, so cook them as soon as possible.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Soak the clams in water for 20 minutes to remove any sand. Clams are full of sand and saltwater, and you definitely don’t want to be eating all of that. Fill a pot or bucket with cold water and soak the clams for 20 minutes to make them expel sand.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8b/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-3.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don’t add salt to the water. This way, the clams will expel saltwater and sand while taking in freshwater.</li> \n    <li>Be careful not to disturb the water too much when you pick up the clams. There will be sand at the bottom of the pot, and if you kick that up, you’ll get the clams dirty again.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Rinse and scrub the clams to get rid of any leftover dirt. Hold each clam under running water and give them a good scrub with a clean, firm brush. This should get rid of any leftover sand or dirt so it doesn't end up in your dinner! After you scrub the clams, transfer them to a plate or bowl and keep them close by.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3e/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-4.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You don't have to use soap to clean the clams. The boiling water should get rid of any germs.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Stuffed-Clams&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Steaming the Clams\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steaming-the-Clams\">Steaming the Clams</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Heat 2 tbsp (30 ml) of olive oil in a large pot. Turn the heat to medium-high, then pour in oil. Heat the oil until it starts bubbling a bit.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-5.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can also add minced garlic and butter for more flavor.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Saute 1 chopped red onion in the hot oil. Roughly chop the onion ahead of time and stir it into the pot. Cook the onion pieces until they soften and turn translucent, which is usually about 5 minutes.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 6 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you prefer, you can also <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Steam-Clams\" title=\"Steam Clams\">steam the clams</a> with just water. This won’t be as flavorful, but it works just fine and takes less time to prep.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add 1 cup (237 ml) of white wine and bring it to a simmer. Pour the wine into the pot and heat it until it simmers. When it starts bubbling, then it's ready. This gives the clams some extra flavoring.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-7.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Be careful not to splash when you’re pouring everything into the pot. You could get burned.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add the clams to the pot and let them steam for 5-7 minutes. After the wine simmers, add the clams to the pot and stir everything together. Cover the pot and let the clams simmer. When they’re cooked, the shells will open up. Steam the clams until all of them open.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-8.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>1 or 2 clams may not open, meaning they were dead when you put them in the pot. This is normal and there are a few in every batch, so if all the other clams have opened, then the clams are done. Get rid of the unopened ones.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Remove the clams from the pot and let them cool off. When the clams are open, turn off the heat. Scoop each clam out with a slotted spoon and transfer them to a baking sheet. Let them cool off until you can touch them without getting burned.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b6/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-9.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Remember to get rid of any clams that didn’t open.</li> \n    <li>Keep the broth from the pot to use in the clam stuffing.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Separate the clam shells by pulling them apart. When the clams are cool enough to handle, grab each one near the front opening. Pull the 2 pieces of the shell apart until they separate completely. You might need to twist the shells a little bit to pull them apart. Repeat this for each clam.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7f/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-10.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This recipe only uses 1 side of each clam shell, so you can get rid of the other half of the shells.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Slice up the clam meat and put it in 1 side of each shell. Pull the meat out of each clam shell and put it on a cutting board. Use a sharp knife and slice each piece into roughly sections. Then lay the clam shells face-up. Scoop up the sliced meat and put it back into each shell. Press the meat down with a spoon so none falls out.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-11.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Keep the pieces from each individual clam separate so you can put the right amount back into each shell.</li> \n    <li>If you prefer the clam pieces smaller, then mince them up into tiny pieces.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>You could also keep the clam meat whole and leave it in the shell. This is a slightly different recipe that’s just as delicious, and it’s a little less prep work.</li> \n    <li>If you want meatier stuffed clams, you could also mix in some minced clam meat to make the meal more filling.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>If you’re preparing the clams ahead of time, you can prep them up to this point and save them for up to a day in the refrigerator before cooking.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Stuffed-Clams&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Making Delicious Stuffing\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Making-Delicious-Stuffing\">Making Delicious Stuffing</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Heat 2 tbsp (30 ml) of olive oil in a frying pan. Turn the heat to medium, then pour in the olive oil. Heat the oil until it bubbles slightly.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6f/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-12.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For more flavor, you can also use 1 stick of butter instead of oil to cook the onions and garlic. This will give you a saltier, creamier taste.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Saute garlic and chopped onion in a pan for 5 minutes. Chop up 1/2 of a medium white onion and mince 2 cloves of garlic. Then add them to the pan with the oil. Stir frequently until the onions sizzle and turn translucent, about 5 minutes, then turn the heat off.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-13.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Stir in breadcrumbs, herbs, and seasonings. Pour 1 cup (125 g) of breadcrumbs into the pan and stir it in. Then you have a lot of choices for seasonings and flavorings to add. For a classic recipe, try adding 2 tbsp (7.2 g) of chopped parsley, 1 tsp (1 g) of chopped dill, 1 tsp (1 g) of thyme, 1/2 tsp (1/2 g) of rosemary, and salt and black pepper to taste. Stir the mixture well so all the ingredients are distributed evenly.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-14.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 14.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/66/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-14.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-14.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Feel free to add more or less of each ingredient if you want to.</li> \n    <li>There are a lot of variations for which flavorings to use for stuffed clams. You can add some Parmesan cheese, crab meat, or red pepper flakes to the stuffing as well.</li> \n    <li>For a bonus, try adding some chopped bacon or pancetta to the stuffing too.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Moisten the stuffing with clam broth. Run the broth that you cooked the clams in through a strainer to get rid of any sand. Then slowly pour the broth into the stuffing, one spoonful at a time. Just moisten the top of the stuffing with the clam juice to give the stuffing a nice clam flavor, then stir it all together.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-15.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 15.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9c/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-15.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-15.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you made the clams ahead of time, strain out some of the broth and save it for the stuffing.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Fill each clam shell with a scoop of the stuffing. Scoop out the stuffing in a spoon and press it into each clam shell, covering the meat. Smooth out the top of the stuffing with the back of the spoon for a nice presentation. Stuff each shell evenly.<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup> \n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-16.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 16.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-16.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-16.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Stuffed-Clams&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Baking and Serving the Clams\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Baking-and-Serving-the-Clams\">Baking and Serving the Clams</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Preheat the oven at . Set the oven to so you don't burn the clams. Then wait 10-15 minutes for the oven to preheat.<sup id=\"_ref-21\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 21\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-21\">[21]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-17.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 17.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/89/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-17.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-17.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you're cooking everything at once, start the oven before making the stuffing so it’s nice and hot when you’re ready to bake.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Bake the clams for 25-30 minutes. Arrange the shells evenly on a baking sheet and pop them in the oven. The clams should take about 25-30 minutes to cook. Remove the clams when the stuffing turns a nice golden brown color.<sup id=\"_ref-22\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 22\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-22\">[22]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-18.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 18.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f9/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-18.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-18.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Check on the clams every few minutes to keep an eye on them. Take them out if the stuffing is getting dark. When the stuffing turns black, then the clams are burning.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Broil the clams for 1-2 minutes if you want crunchier stuffing. If you prefer a little crisp in your stuffing, then the broiler is just what you need. When the clams are done baking, put them under the broiler for another 1-2 minutes. This should crisp up the stuffing with a nice finish.<sup id=\"_ref-23\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 23\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-23\">[23]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-19.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 19.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-19.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-19.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Remember to keep an eye on the clams to make sure they don’t start burning.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Garnish the clams with lemon and parsley before serving them. Once the clams are done, take them out of the oven and let them cool. Before serving, you can sprinkle a bit of chopped parsley over them and squeeze on some fresh lemon juice for extra flavor. Then enjoy!<sup id=\"_ref-24\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 24\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Stuffed-Clams#_note-24\">[24]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-20.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Stuffed Clams Step 20.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2f/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-20.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-20.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you have leftovers, baked clams can last 3-4 days in the refrigerator if they’re in an airtight container.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Stuffed-Clams&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Things You’ll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You’ll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.E2.80.99ll-Need\">Things You’ll Need</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Pot</li> \n  <li>Frying pan</li> \n  <li>Oven</li> \n  <li>Spoons</li> \n  <li>Knife</li> \n  <li>Cutting board</li> \n  <li>Baking sheet</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Stuffed-Clams&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>There are tons of different recipes for the clam stuffing, so don't be afraid to experiment! Add different spices and flavorings if you want to branch out.</li> \n  <li>Baked clams go great as a side dish in a seafood meal, or with pasta for an Italian twist.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Stuffed-Clams&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap href=\"https://www.pbs.org/food/recipes/baked-stuffed-clams/\">https://www.pbs.org/food/recipes/baked-stuffed-clams/</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 02 Oct 2020 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-1.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"db059f9b6c771e48b56581fc10b50c47","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn22@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-01-787_10afd3c42e9e3227.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":117378,"destBytes":84064,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-1.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn22@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-01-787_10afd3c42e9e3227.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/54/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-2.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn87@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-23-395_cdc43c00f1d29ae3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8b/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-3.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn71@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-19-568_e5bca1e0e4bc8e9e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3e/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-4.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn21@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-27-554_8a28e2030641e1a4.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-5.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn10@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-18-134_94203067113ed497.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-6-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn9@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-25-317_49b8b22d2072d6ca.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-7.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn31@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-25-160_68664145293bc0ee.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-8.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn99@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-28-496_1aa48ef27d64bb74.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b6/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-9.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn84@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-19-007_f6ddb8f14081914a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7f/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-10.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn79@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-22-947_507f8d8284d43ac8.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-11.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn67@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-27-503_288cbfe1d8158fe0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6f/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-12.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn3@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-21-490_d68fe77568134fa1.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-13.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-13.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn35@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-17-998_0e064b675f70ff26.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/66/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-14.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-14.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn36@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-21-119_5cd3d170e4f0cdec.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9c/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-15.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-15.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn87@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-19-000_b19d49008e4bcc64.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-16.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-16.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn10@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-23-787_139c29889a3f6d5e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/89/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-17.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-17.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn74@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-25-126_a9d6a9f120e523d6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f9/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-18.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-18.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn66@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-23-491_9261ef60f6774f69.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-19.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-19.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn75@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-19-343_6e009b8d2a342e90.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2f/Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-20.jpg/aid12172018-v4-728px-Cook-Stuffed-Clams-Step-20.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn14@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-28-615_d4533315450c8733.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214380952},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","title":"How to Help Children Understand Misinformation About COVID","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>For better or for worse, children tend to have active imaginations. With COVID-19 being everywhere on the news and a hot conversation topic, your child may have some misconceptions about the virus and may be feeling on edge. There’s no need to stress—there are plenty of parents and caregivers who are in the exact same position as you. Even if you’re feeling a little uncertain about the future, you can take a few extra precautions to help your kids really understand what’s going on as the COVID-19 pandemic continues. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Talking about COVID-19\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Talking-about-COVID-19\">Talking about COVID-19</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Speak to your children in a calm and relaxed tone. Children are really sensitive to what you say and do. If you sound stressed or concerned while talking about the virus, your children may pick up on this concern and feel stressed out themselves. Instead, make an effort to sound relaxed as you prepare to explain what’s going on in the world.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-01-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Help Children Understand Misinformation About COVID Step 01 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ee/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-01-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-01-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can say extra things to help calm your children down, like “There’s a lot of really smart people who are working to stop this virus,” or “You can stay extra safe and healthy by washing your hands a lot.”</li> \n    <li>For instance, you can start off by saying something like this: “You’re a smart cookie, and I’m sure you’ve heard a lot about the virus that’s going around. It may seem scary, but there are lots of things we can do to stay healthy.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Employ simple language when you talk with your child. A lot of news reports and technical articles use a lot of technical jargon to describe the most recent data and tests. While this information may be useful for adults, it’ll only be confusing and off-putting to your children. Instead, try to water down the situation into easy, conversational language that your child can understand completely.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-02-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Help Children Understand Misinformation About COVID Step 02 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e4/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-02-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-02-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, instead of saying “Symptomatic people need to stay home,” you can say something like: “If you’re feeling sick, you should stay home until you feel all better.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Answer any questions your kids may have about the virus. Encourage your child to share any and all questions they have about the virus, so you can ease their worries while keeping them informed.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup> Maintain a calm, relaxed tone while you talk with your kids, doing your best to answer each question to the best of your ability. If you don’t know an answer, don’t feel the need to make something up—just let your kids know that you’ll look it up and have an answer for them soon.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-03-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Help Children Understand Misinformation About COVID Step 03 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/35/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-03-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-03-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can always start a conversation with something like: “What have you heard about the virus so far?” or “Has anyone from school told you anything about the virus?”</li> \n    <li>You may need to filter some of your language so it’s more age-appropriate for your kids.</li> \n    <li>For instance, you can say something like: “The virus is an icky germ that gets spread around when people sneeze and cough.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Avoid watching the news when your kids are around. Children have really wild imaginations, and there’s no telling what or how they’ll react to different news reports. With this in mind, keep your TV off the news channel while your kids are in the room so they aren’t barraged with unpleasant, scary information. Instead, let your children watch age-appropriate TV and movies that aren’t related to plagues, pandemics, or illness in general.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-04-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Help Children Understand Misinformation About COVID Step 04 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-04-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-04-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you choose to show your children a video about COVID-19, watch it ahead of time to make sure it’s appropriate and not too complex.</li> \n    <li>Avoid games like <i>Plague, Inc.</i>, along with movies like <i>Train to Busan</i>, <i>Contagion</i>, or <i>World War Z</i>.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Double-check that everything you’re saying is accurate. Take a few minutes to cross-check your information with reputable sources, like the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). While it’s important to keep your children informed, you don’t want to spread false information by mistake. You can stop misinformation in its tracks by telling your kids the facts instead of sharing any speculation.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-05-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Help Children Understand Misinformation About COVID Step 05 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-05-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-05-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, you can explain that “COVID-19” stands for “coronavirus 2019,” or that washing your hands can prevent the spread of germs.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Watch what you say and discuss around your children. It’s perfectly understandable if you’re feeling nervous and uncertain during these stressful times. With this in mind, try to be aware of where your children are. Above all else, do your best to stay calm and collected instead of reacting unpleasantly to any news updates.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-06-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Help Children Understand Misinformation About COVID Step 06 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/57/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-06-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-06-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Go easy on yourself. Many parents and caregivers are in the same boat as you. Don’t be afraid to reach out for help and support if you need it!</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Remind your kids that they’re perfectly safe. Try to view the pandemic from a child’s perspective. They’ve likely seen or heard reports about a lot of people dying, which is anxiety-inducing for any person to hear. Tell your kids that they’re safe and out of harm's way, however many times they need to hear it.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-07-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Help Children Understand Misinformation About COVID Step 07 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/60/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-07-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-07-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can say something like: “There’s no need to worry. I’ll do my very best to keep us all safe and healthy.”</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Reaffirming the Facts\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Reaffirming-the-Facts\">Reaffirming the Facts</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Address some rumors that your children may have heard. Your children are likely talking about the virus with their friends in one form or another. Correct any misinformation your children are hearing then and there to stop them in their tracks. Instead, share factual information supported by experts, so your children can feel more at ease.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-08-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Help Children Understand Misinformation About COVID Step 08 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/77/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-08-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-08-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, your child may say something like: “John told me we don’t really have to wear masks, and that the virus goes directly into your brain.” In response, you can say something like: “The virus is really similar to the flu, or having a bad cold. Wearing masks helps you stay healthy.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Explain that the virus spreads without anyone noticing. Young kids may not understand what a virus is or how it spreads so quickly. Help break the concept down into bite-sized pieces by explaining that a virus is something tiny and invisible that causes people to feel less than their best. Explain that the virus spreads whenever you sneeze or cough, which is why it’s important to wear masks and stand at a distance from other people. Mention that some people may feel sore, or feel like they have a bad cold.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-09-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Help Children Understand Misinformation About COVID Step 09 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-09-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-09-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, you can say something like, “You may feel icky for a few days, like your nose is really stuffy. If this happens, you just need to drink lots of water and get lots of sleep.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Reassure your child that COVID-19 is usually just a bad cold. With all the doom and gloom on the news, it may help to paint a more accurate picture for your kids of what the virus looks like. Keep stressing that the virus is similar to a cold, and that you’ll feel a little achy, warm, and less than your best if you catch it. Additionally, gently explain that some people may get a little sicker than others since their bodies aren’t as strong and healthy.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Help Children Understand Misinformation About COVID Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d2/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, you can say something like: “There’s nothing to worry about. If you get the virus, you may get some sniffles and feel a little achy. It’s nothing a bit of bed rest and TLC can’t handle!”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Remind your child that it’s easy to practice healthy habits. While you shouldn’t downplay the virus, let your kids know that’s very easy to stay healthy at home by washing your hands often and wearing a mask when you go outside. Additionally, teach your kids how to sneeze and cough into their elbows, so they aren’t as likely to spread germs.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Help Children Understand Misinformation About COVID Step 11 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0f/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can make or purchase a mask for your kid that features some of their favorite cartoon characters or other interests, which may make them more willing to wear a mask.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Let your children know that many people are working to keep everyone safe. Remind your kids that there are lots of really smart people all over the world looking for a way to cure the virus. These smart people are getting closer and closer to a solution, and are working around-the-clock to keep everyone safe and healthy.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Help Children Understand Misinformation About COVID Step 12 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/70/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, you can show your kids how to wash their hands properly by washing and rinsing for 20 seconds.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Explain to your children how staying at home can help others. Your kids are probably getting a lot of cabin fever from being cooped up at home for so long. Do your best to sympathize with their frustrations, while reminding them that social distancing is an important part of helping others. Explain that staying at home prevents you from sharing or receiving invisible, nasty germs that can make you sick.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Help Children Understand Misinformation About COVID Step 13 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2e/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Your child may complain about how their friend is allowed to go to the beach, while they have to stay at home. You can say something like: “I know it seems really unfair, but staying at home helps keep everyone safe and healthy. Once everything calms down, we’ll be able to go to the beach together!”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Emphasize that any person can get the virus. Kids can hear a lot of different rumors and opinions from a lot of different sources. If you hear your kids saying something harmful or incorrect, take some time to correct them. Remind your children that anyone from any background can get COVID-19, no matter what the color of their skin is.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Help Children Understand Misinformation About COVID Step 14 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, you can say something like: “The virus spreads really easily, and anyone can catch it. It isn’t fair to say that some people are more likely to spread the sickness than others.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Help your children practice empathy towards people who are sick. Remind your kids that there’s nothing wrong with being sick and that people who tested positive for COVID-19 need a lot of love and support as they continue to get better. Encourage your child to express concern and good wishes for all sick individuals, and not just people they know.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Help Children Understand Misinformation About COVID Step 15 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f6/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Continue modeling healthy behavior around your home, like washing your hands and sneezing into a tissue. Additionally, remind your children not to touch their eyes, nose or mouth.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup></li> \n  <li>Coping with the COVID-19 crisis as an adult can be incredibly overwhelming. If you feel like you’re at the end of your rope, you can call the Disaster Distress Hotline at 1-800-985-5990. This hotline can offer on-the-spot counseling, and also give you some tips for dealing with your stress.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap
