/myreaderx25/cdn44@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-19-625_5bc0739c14fa70a4.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/57/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-06-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-06-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn12@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-20-565_141b8501abc22771.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/60/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-07-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-07-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn56@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-23-586_ac9a59879c49c0f0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/77/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-08-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-08-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn46@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-24-896_5a2801cb55652c46.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-09-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-09-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn80@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-18-212_45e0905ada3aa095.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d2/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn48@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-20-917_67f0bb58c5444e67.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0f/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-11-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn17@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-29-286_5e37ddde2b26aabd.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/70/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-12-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn60@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-26-684_7b9243d94f6713cf.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2e/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-13-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn27@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-20-728_b1cdadc4561c9536.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-14-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn5@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-26-095_3981c23d004759b5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f6/Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid12107729-v4-728px-Help-Children-Understand-Misinformation-About-COVID-Step-15-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn54@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-27-016_99ef42dbc4abac35.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214380941},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","title":"How to Wear Gray Shoes","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>If you don’t have a pair of gray shoes in your closet, you’re missing out on a great opportunity! Gray shoes are so subtle and stylish that you can wear them with all kinds of different outfits. Use them to complete a casual outfit or balance out a stellar ensemble full of colors and patterns. They’re great with a suit, a dress, or jeans, and you’ll be glad you have them when you can’t decide which shoes to throw on the next time you’re walking out the door. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wear-Gray-Shoes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wear-Gray-Shoes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Casual Outfits\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Casual-Outfits\">Casual Outfits</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Lighten up a darker outfit with a pair of light gray shoes. For this particular look, ankle boots, flats, heels, boat shoes, espadrilles, and loafers all look quite lovely. This outfit combo is especially great if you like wearing all black or darker shades of blues, purples, and greens, but still want a little variety in your wardrobe. Light gray shoes, while not colorful, do add a softer element to your outfit and can balance your look.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wear Gray Shoes Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/38/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-1.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Black jeans with a dark plum blouse or button-up would look nice with a light gray pair of flats, fashion sneakers, or Oxfords.</li> \n    <li>For a more casual outfit, pair forest-green pants with a black top and light gray flats or espadrilles.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Balance a patterned or brightly-colored outfit with a gray shoe. The shoe's neutrality won’t compete for visual attention and gives you a lot of fun space to play around with the elements in your outfit. Bold patterns and bright colors will look fantastic paired with subtle shoes and accessories.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wear Gray Shoes Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-2.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For a dressier outfit, choose a pair of gray heels or pointed-toe flats. For a more casual look, wear ballet flats or a pair or plan fashion sneakers.</li> \n    <li>For example, wear coral pants with a navy blue sweater. Finish it off with light gray sneakers and a silver watch.</li> \n    <li>For a fun date-night outfit, wear a bright red skirt and white polka-dotted blouse. Add a pair of charcoal grey kitten heels, and you’re good to go!</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Pair denim and gray shoes for an outfit that works in many different situations. Darker denim looks more dressed up, while lighter denim looks more casual. To keep an outfit on the dressier side, stick with shoes like dress shoes, heels, or ankle boots. For a relaxed vibe, wear flats, loafers, or sneakers.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wear Gray Shoes Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-3.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, dark denim jeans and a nice sweater paired with gray derby shoes or ankle boots look dressy enough to wear to a dinner out with friends.</li> \n    <li>For a cozy look that's still chic, try wearing grey ankle boots with casual boyfriend jeans, a T-shirt, an oversized sweater, and a patterned shawl.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>A pair of light-wash jeans and charcoal-gray sneakers would look great for running errands or going to the movies.</li> \n    <li>For a more tailored, put-together look, wear a pair of tailored, dark-denim jeans with gray dress shoes. This is a great outfit to wear to a party or special dinner.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add textural variety to your outfit with a pair of suede dress shoes. Suede shoes look soft, supple, and classy. Elevate a super casual outfit, or use them as an accompaniment with a more chic ensemble.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wear Gray Shoes Step 4 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>A pair of tapered jeans and a plain or patterned T-shirt would look stylish and more put-together with suede Oxfords or flats.</li> \n    <li>For a more sophisticated outfit, combine fitted black jeans with a dressy top, like a cream blouse or a knit sweater. Add a pair of suede flats or derby shoes to complete your outfit.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Pop on a pair of gray trainers with your athletic shorts to keep things stylish. Instead of wearing an outdated pair of sneakers, switch things up with a nice pair of gray trainers that can transition from the gym to running errands to meeting up with friends at the park. Look for a low-top rather than a high-rise to keep your outfit on the casual side.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wear Gray Shoes Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a2/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-5.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>A nice white tee and a pair of navy shorts would look chic and neat with gray trainers. Bring along a zip-up jacket in case things get cold!</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Wear gray canvas sneakers for a no-fuss look. With a pair of these shoes in your closet, you’ll have something to slip on with tons of different outfits. They’re a neutral color, so they won’t compete with another color or pattern, and they don’t clash with much. Have them on hand for days when you need to grab a pair of shoes and be on your way.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wear Gray Shoes Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-6.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Put on your favorite pair of jeans, a black-and-white striped top, and your gray canvas sneakers for a casual yet comfortable outfit.</li> \n    <li>Keep things super simple with a pair of shorts and a graphic tee. Put on your canvas shoes and head out the door!</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wear-Gray-Shoes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Work-Appropriate and Formal Outfits\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Work-Appropriate-and-Formal-Outfits\">Work-Appropriate and Formal Outfits</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Create a dashing appearance with light gray dress shoes and a dark suit. Navy blue, charcoal gray, and black suits all look good with gray shoes. A suede material would look dapper, too, especially if you don’t want to wear a shiny shoe.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wear Gray Shoes Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/09/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-7.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This look is great for the office or fancy dinners or events.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Match shades of gray for a sophisticated monochrome vibe. The most important thing with this option is that the shades of gray have to be the same. If they’re not, your outfit won’t have the same impact.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wear Gray Shoes Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8d/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-8.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If this feels a little too solid for you, choose a gray dress shoe that’s a shade darker than your outfit’s other gray element.</li> \n    <li>For an office-appropriate look, wear a pair of tailored black slacks with a light gray turtleneck. Finish the outfit with light gray kitten heels.</li> \n    <li>Wear a navy blue suit with charcoal gray dress shoes. Add a charcoal gray tie to bring the outfit together.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Complement a dress or skirt with a pair of gray heels. If you’re going to a fancy gala or special event, gray might be a little too understated, but it’s perfect for a day at the office or an important meeting. In warmer weather, feel free to wear open-toed heels if they’re appropriate for the setting. In cooler weather, stick with closed-toed shoes.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wear Gray Shoes Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/32/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-9.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, a black pencil shirt and peach blouse would look sophisticated and streamlined when paired with a nice pair of gray heels. Stiletto and cone heels are especially versatile and timeless.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Or, wear an olive green dress with light gray heels for a neutrally-toned yet still eye-catching outfit.</li> \n    <li>If heels aren’t your thing, look for a pair of gray flats. Pick a pair with pointed toes for a more stylish option, or get rounded toes for a more subdued look.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add a casual element to a fancy suit with a pair of classic gray sneakers. This can be a tough look to pull off, and it won’t work for every situation. The best place to wear this combo would be to a night out or a special event where it won’t look out of place for you to be a little more creative with your fashion choices.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wear Gray Shoes Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-10.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don’t wear shoes that you would wear to the gym. Fashion sneakers are the way to go with this look.</li> \n    <li>To keep the casual-formal vibe flowing, consider wearing a nice white or black shirt under your suit jacket rather than a button-up.</li> \n    <li>If a sneaker feels way too casual for you, try a pair of chukkas. They’re less dressy than a derby or Oxford shoes, but still add a slightly dressed-down element to your outfit.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Create a great date-night outfit with colored pants and a gray shoe. Blue, red, and olive pants add a lot to your look and will look great paired with gray dress shoes or heels. Always choose more fitted or tailored pants, and keep your top more neutrally-colored for a sophisticated vibe.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wear Gray Shoes Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/70/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-11.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Wear red skinny pants with a black blouse and dark gray suede heels for a classy outfit that works for a date or a day at the office.</li> \n    <li>Pair Egyptian or azure blue pants with light gray Oxfords and a kelly green sweater for a bright, fashion-forward combo.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Match your belt to your shoe for a put-together look. Especially if you’re wearing a suit, it’s a good idea to keep your accessories, likes your shoes and belts, the same shade of gray. Otherwise, you might look a little sloppy and mismatched. Avoid mixing gray shoes with brown belts.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wear Gray Shoes Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/18/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-12.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you don’t have a gray belt that matches your shoes, opt for a black belt with a silver buckle.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wear-Gray-Shoes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Avoid wearing gray shoes with brown or tan pants. Gray shoes are fantastic in that they look great with almost any other color—except browns. When you start pairing those two shades, it can be tricky to create an outfit that doesn’t look haphazard or clumsy.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wear-Gray-Shoes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"external free\" href=\"https://bespokeunit.com/shoes/trouser-coordination/grey-shoes/\">https://bespokeunit.com/shoes/trouser-coordination/grey-shoes/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_ref-6\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.gq-magazine.co.uk/article/how-to-wear-mens-grey-suede-shoes\">https://www.gq-magazine.co.uk/article/how-to-wear-mens-grey-suede-shoes</a></span> </li> \n noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/HR_VDWnXYig?t=228\">https://youtu.be/HR_VDWnXYig?t=228</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://womens-fashion.lovetoknow.com/fashion-tips-women/matching-dress-shoes\">https://womens-fashion.lovetoknow.com/fashion-tips-women/matching-dress-shoes</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_ref-12\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\">[v160992_b01]. 13 May 2019.</span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_ref-13\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/celiashatzman/2019/10/17/the-best-chic-sneakers-that-work-with-every-outfit/#3c439b087529\">https://www.forbes.com/sites/celiashatzman/2019/10/17/the-best-chic-sneakers-that-work-with-every-outfit/#3c439b087529</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_ref-14\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://bespokeunit.com/shoes/trouser-coordination/grey-shoes/\">https://bespokeunit.com/shoes/trouser-coordination/grey-shoes/</a></span> </li> \n   <li </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wear-Gray-Shoes#_ref-16\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer href=\"https://brightside.me/inspiration-tips-and-tricks/how-to-perfectly-match-your-shoes-to-any-outfit-388910/\">https://brightside.me/inspiration-tips-and-tricks/how-to-perfectly-match-your-shoes-to-any-outfit-388910/</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 05 Oct 2020 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/38/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-1.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"b7885a6e8db4611da701c2aa7c46b032","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn51@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-01-807_3812765fd872aa1a.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":39952,"destBytes":27770,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/38/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-1.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn51@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-01-807_3812765fd872aa1a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-2.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn91@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-26-895_bc240fd0cc8e8a95.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-3.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn59@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-23-463_a3953da246e90886.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-4-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn13@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-18-248_c749aed0e1bbfd29.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a2/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-5.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn3@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-19-552_ee9cd635e7b50f7c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-6.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn88@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-22-118_a1f5890588e08d2b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/09/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-7.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn76@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-27-630_1cfeda7fd68b5adc.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8d/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-8.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn19@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-23-324_e618185419c6877d.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/32/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-9.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn24@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-23-156_35ab7ae6bbfcf8cf.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-10.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn25@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-26-327_f7f49aa60082f5c6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/70/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-11.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn24@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-19-494_d012fd401ab6c79a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/18/Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-12.jpg/aid12156280-v4-728px-Wear-Gray-Shoes-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn60@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-22-512_4d00492f9c73a9b9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214380935},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","title":"How to Do Office Yoga","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Have you ever gotten done with a long day at work and felt completely drained? You may not realize it, but work stress and sitting at a desk all day takes a toll on your body. If you start feeling tired and sore while you’re on the clock, you can luckily do some simple yoga stretches right in your office! While you can’t get into all of the complex poses from a yoga class, you can still perform a lot of them without getting out of your chair. Even if you only have a few free minutes, you can use them to rejuvenate your work day! </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Office-Yoga&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Office-Yoga&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Neck and Shoulder Relief\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Neck-and-Shoulder-Relief\">Neck and Shoulder Relief</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Tilt your head so it touches your shoulder if your neck feels tight. You might feel neck strain if you’re slouching or tensing your shoulders throughout the day. Sit up straight so your back isn’t touching your chair. Keep your head directly above your spine and your shoulders relaxed. Slowly tilt your head to the left so your ear touches your shoulder. Hold the position for 5 counts before returning to the starting position. Then tilt your head to the right and hold it for another 5 counts.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Office-Yoga-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Office Yoga Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Do-Office-Yoga-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid2398731-v4-728px-Do-Office-Yoga-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you want a deeper stretch, gently push your head further down with your hand.</li> \n    <li>You may also feel relief if you massage your neck lightly as you stop stretching.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Do neck circles when you’re feeling stiff. If your neck still aches, you may need to try this deeper stretch. Lower your head and tuck your chin against your chest. Slowly roll your head to the right so your ear touches your right shoulder. Bring your head back until your chin points up to the ceiling. Roll your head onto your left shoulder and back down to your chest to finish the circle. Then do a full circle moving your head in the opposite direction.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Office-Yoga-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Office Yoga Step 2 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Do-Office-Yoga-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid2398731-v4-728px-Do-Office-Yoga-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you feel any pain while doing neck circles, stop immediately so you don’t strain or hurt yourself.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Roll your shoulders if they’re tense. Make sure you sit up so your back is off of the chair. Lift your shoulders up as high as you comfortably can and hold them there. Slowly push your shoulders back and lower them back down in a circular motion. Do 4–5 shoulder rolls going backward. After that, reverse the direction so you move your shoulders back before lifting them up.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Office-Yoga-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Office Yoga Step 3 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Do-Office-Yoga-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid2398731-v4-728px-Do-Office-Yoga-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This stretch can also improve your circulation near your shoulder joints.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Bend at the hips and reach out in front of you to loosen your shoulders. Stand up and move your chair to the side so you have some more room. Put your palms flat on your desk and walk backward until your arms are fully extended. Keep your back straight and bend 90 degrees at the hips. Press down on the table and push your hips back for 5–10 counts before you relax again. <sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Office-Yoga-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Office Yoga Step 4 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fb/Do-Office-Yoga-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid2398731-v4-728px-Do-Office-Yoga-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try to keep your legs straight during this pose, but don’t worry if you need to bend your knees a little bit.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Office-Yoga&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Upper Body Stretches\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Upper-Body-Stretches\">Upper Body Stretches</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Try a cat-cow stretch when you want to improve your posture. If you’re looking for something that’s discrete and easy to do while sitting down, this is the stretch for you. Sit at the edge of your chair with your legs shoulder-width apart. Put your hands on your thighs and slowly inhale as you arch your back. Tilt your head back as you do this. When you exhale, round out your spine by dropping your chin closer to your chest. Go through 4–5 breaths to feel relief throughout your back.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Office-Yoga-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Office Yoga Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Do-Office-Yoga-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid2398731-v4-728px-Do-Office-Yoga-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This pose can also help your circulation.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Avoid jutting your chin forward when you’re arching your back since you could compress your neck vertebra.</li> \n    <li>For a variation on this, lean forward with your elbows on your thighs. Relax your body as you lean forward—you can even deepen the stretch by reaching your hands down to touch the floor or resting your hands on your ankles.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Twist to the side while you’re sitting down if your upper back feels stiff. Sit on the front of your chair and inhale as you lengthen your spine. When you exhale, turn either to the left or the right side. If you need to, you can hold onto your table, desk, or the side of your chair to gently twist out to one side. You can rotate your head to gaze back as well. Hold this for about 5 breaths, then come back to the middle before repeating for the other side.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Office-Yoga-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Office Yoga Step 6 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d1/Do-Office-Yoga-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid2398731-v4-728px-Do-Office-Yoga-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you’re sitting in a rolling chair, hold onto your desk or lock the wheels while performing this stretch.</li> \n    <li>Try doing this about once every hour to keep tension from building up in your body.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>You can also stretch your sides by leaning sideways over first one arm of the chair, then the other. As you lean to one side, reach the opposite hand over your head. Hold this for 4-5 breaths.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Lace your fingers behind your back and raise your arms to open your chest. You can do this stretch whether you’re sitting or standing. Scoot to the front edge of your chair and lean forward slightly so there’s enough room to fully extend your arms behind you. Reach behind your lower back and lace your fingers together. Keep your arms straight as you lift your hands up. Raise them as high as you comfortably can and hold the position for 10–15 breaths. Slowly ease out of the pose when you’re finished.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Office-Yoga-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Office Yoga Step 7 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Do-Office-Yoga-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid2398731-v4-728px-Do-Office-Yoga-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try leaning forward slightly so you can feel the stretch deeper in your chest.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Extend your arm and pull your hand back to help your wrist flexibility. Working at a computer all day really strains your wrists and can cause a bit of pain. When you feel your wrist getting tight, extend your arm straight out in front of you with your palm face-up. Grab the tips of your fingers with your other hand and gently pull them back toward your body for 5 counts. Then, turn your palm face-down and push down on the back of your hand for another 5 counts. Switch arms so both your wrists stay loose.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Office-Yoga-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Office Yoga Step 8 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cb/Do-Office-Yoga-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid2398731-v4-728px-Do-Office-Yoga-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can do this stretch seated or standing.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Perform the reverse prayer pose to loosen up your hands and wrists. Sit on the edge of your chair so you have room to do the pose. Reach your hands behind your lower back and keep your elbows bent. Turn your hands so your fingers point up and press your palms together. Try to scoot your hands as far up your back as you can. Take a few 4–5 breaths and relax on your final exhale.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Office-Yoga-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Office Yoga Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/16/Do-Office-Yoga-Step-9.jpg/aid2398731-v4-728px-Do-Office-Yoga-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This pose requires a bit of flexibility, so you might not be able to perform it at first. Keep working on it and eventually you’ll be able to press your palms together.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Office-Yoga&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Lower Body Exercises\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Lower-Body-Exercises\">Lower Body Exercises</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Lift your knees up to release tension in your hips. Sit up straight with your back slightly off of the chair and your feet shoulder-width apart. Grab the crook of your knee with both hands and pull it straight up as high as you comfortably can. Make sure you keep your back relaxed so you feel the stretch in your hips. Hold the position while you inhale and slowly lower it back down as you exhale. Then repeat the stretch with your other leg.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Office-Yoga-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Office Yoga Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Do-Office-Yoga-Step-10.jpg/aid2398731-v4-728px-Do-Office-Yoga-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This stretch might also help with your digestion.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Do hip openers if you want to stretch your glutes. Sit at the edge of your seat so your legs are shoulder-width apart. Lift up your right foot and rest your ankle on your left knee. Gently lean forward at the hips to help loosen up your glutes. Hold the pose for 5 counts and relax when you exhale. Then do the same stretch with your left leg.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Office-Yoga-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Office Yoga Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9c/Do-Office-Yoga-Step-11.jpg/aid2398731-v4-728px-Do-Office-Yoga-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>It’s normal if the leg you dominantly use is more flexible than the other. Your dominant leg is usually on the same side of your body as your dominant hand.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Try the seahorse pose for a deep stretch through your torso and legs. Sit near the right corner of your seat or sideways on your chair if it doesn’t have any arms. Keep your left foot firmly planted on the ground in front of you. Bend your right leg back so your knee drops down and the top of your foot touches the floor. Bend backward at the hips and hold the position for 1–2 counts. Then switch legs so you stretch them evenly.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Office-Yoga-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Office Yoga Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/87/Do-Office-Yoga-Step-12.jpg/aid2398731-v4-728px-Do-Office-Yoga-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Hold onto your chair or a sturdy object while doing this stretch so you don’t fall.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Put your foot on your chair and lean forward to stretch your legs. If you have room in your office, lift your foot onto your seat and straighten your leg. Bend forward at the hips until you feel the stretch running down your legs all the way to your foot. Stay in your pose for 3 counts before resting. Then stretch your other leg the same way.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Office-Yoga-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Office Yoga Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Do-Office-Yoga-Step-13.jpg/aid2398731-v4-728px-Do-Office-Yoga-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This stretch really helps circulation in your legs so you don’t develop varicose veins or swelling.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Try side bends when you’re feeling tight around your waist. You can do side bends sitting, but they work best if you’re standing. Step forward with your left foot and keep your toes slightly pointed out. As you inhale, raise your right arm above your head. When you exhale, slowly bend to the left at your hips. Keep your core activated so you don’t arch your lower back. Hold the position for 3 counts before stretching on the right side.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Office-Yoga-Step-14.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Office Yoga Step 14.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/ff/Do-Office-Yoga-Step-14.jpg/aid2398731-v4-728px-Do-Office-Yoga-Step-14.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This pose can strengthen your core muscles and improve your balance.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Office-Yoga&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Office-Yoga&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Even just practicing deep breathing meditation can help you refocus throughout the day. Close your eyes when you’re feeling stressed at work. Inhale for 5 seconds and exhale for 7 seconds for 10 breaths.<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup></li> \n  <li>Ask your coworkers if they want to set aside time to practice yoga together.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Office-Yoga&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Be careful stretching in your chair if it has wheels. Either lock the wheels or hold onto your desk so you don’t roll away.<sup id=\"_ref-21\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 21\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Office-Yoga#_note-21\">[21]</a></sup></li> \n  <li>If you’re working in an office with other people, make sure you’re not disrupting your coworkers while you’re stretching. Try some more discrete poses or find a different time to do yoga.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Office-Yoga&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Computer-Yoga\" title=\"Do Computer Yoga\">Do Computer Yoga</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Yoga-at-Your-Computer\" title=\"Do Yoga at Your Computer\">Do Yoga at Your Computer</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Deal-With-Stress\" title=\"Deal With Stress\">Deal With Stress</a></li> \n  <li><a
