</ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 02 Oct 2020 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-1.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"bbaf352382b66e92b0bd850b05e404b3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn48@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-01-793_88bae19456ca8ab0.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":66194,"destBytes":40096,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-1.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn48@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-01-793_88bae19456ca8ab0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/53/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-2.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-2.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9f/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-3.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn72@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-23-612_77536adc9ec107ba.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/51/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-4.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn58@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-18-545_c6bf0759743df06c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/eb/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-5.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn43@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-20-850_20e5250afc9516cf.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f8/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-6.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn20@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-20-651_7ca16d4c6ea2e75b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/87/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-7.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn10@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-24-896_0f34efe026f8c324.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-8.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn17@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-24-807_a82c746dc5ac0ca6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e7/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-9.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn5@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-28-891_bc2c430bcf29063b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/26/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-10.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn85@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-26-073_89a7aaa6af5c3603.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f1/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-11.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn43@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-27-229_f5697c7abe602341.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/31/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-12.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn34@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-28-024_49bb73078d437de1.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8e/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-13.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-13.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn93@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-25-157_09873febb5e8e5dd.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-14.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-14.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn82@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-25-167_4c1bad63e6a179da.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/92/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-15.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-15.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn20@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-22-412_e21b44d04f6e6802.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-16.jpg/aid12184695-v4-728px-Display-Embroidery-Hoops-Step-16.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn18@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-26-222_7fbdf0a04e4b4822.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214380965},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","title":"How to Do Ballet at Home","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Ballet is a beautiful art form to use for self expression or to stay fit. While taking a dance class is the best way to learn ballet, you can do basic ballet moves at home if you can't take classes or if you just want extra practice. Before you dance, warm up and stretch so your body is ready. Then, learn the 5 positions in ballet and practice basic ballet moves until you master them. When you're ready, build on your technique by following tutorials, doing video lessons, or attending a class. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Ballet-at-Home&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Ballet-at-Home&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Warming Up and Stretching\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warming-Up-and-Stretching\">Warming Up and Stretching</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Choose a room that has space for you to move around. Make sure you have room to bend, leap, and move across the floor without bumping into anything. Remove any items that might impede your movement, like a coffee table or items on the floor. If your room doesn't have a ballet barre, use the back of a sturdy chair for support when you need it.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Cover the floor with a mat or rug if it's a hard surface. Don't do ballet on hard surfaces like concrete unless you put down a mat. Jumping on a hard floor can damage your joints, including your knees. Use an exercise mat or rug to cover hard flooring. Alternatively, do ballet in a room that's carpeted.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 2 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/19/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can find rubber mats that are made for ballet online.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Warm-Up\" title=\"Warm Up\">Warm up</a> your body by doing 5 minutes of low-impact cardio. Your muscles need to be warm before you do ballet to help you avoid injury. To quickly warm up, walk or jog in place for about 5 minutes. If you like, finish your warm-up with a series of <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Free-Squats\" title=\"Do Free Squats\">squats</a>, <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Lunges\" title=\"Do Lunges\">lunges</a>, and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Perform-Jumping-Jacks\" title=\"Perform Jumping Jacks\">jumping jacks</a>.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 3 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make sure you warm up before you stretch because stretching cold muscles increases your risk of injury.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stretch\" title=\"Stretch\">Stretch</a> your muscles after you're warmed up. Once your body's warmed up, stretch your muscles so they're ready for your ballet moves. Here are some stretches to try:<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 4 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/11/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li><b>Do a forward bend:</b> Stand up straight with your feet together and your toes pointing forward. Hinge forward at your waist and reach down to the floor. Go down as far as you can and try to touch the floor. Hold for 30 seconds.</li> \n    <li><b>Do a wide-leg stretch:</b> Sit on the floor and spread your legs out in a “V.” Point your toes up into the air. Lean forward and reach between your legs as far as you can. Hold for 30 seconds.</li> \n    <li><b>Stretch your quads:</b> Your quads are the front of your thighs. Stand up straight with your legs together and hold onto a chair for support. Lift 1 leg behind you and grasp the top of your foot with your hand. Pull your foot into your butt. Hold for 30 seconds, then switch legs.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Ballet-at-Home&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Practicing the 5 Positions in Ballet\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Practicing-the-5-Positions-in-Ballet\">Practicing the 5 Positions in Ballet</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Start with first position because it's the easiest. Stand up straight with your legs together and your heels touching. Turn your toes so they point outwards in a “V.” Then, lift your arms in front of you to make an oval. Your fingers shouldn't be touching.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/07/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Point your toes out as far as you can. At first, you might only be able to make a narrow \"V.\" However, you'll become more flexible over time and may eventually be able to turn your toes all the way out.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Do second position to add more ballet moves. Stand tall with your legs spread slightly wider than shoulder-width apart. Point your toes outward away from your body. Spread your arms out at your sides, keeping them rounded and at about shoulder height.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 6 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c5/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Like with first position, only turn your toes out as far as you comfortably can.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Try third position to help you gain experience. Stand up straight and cross your right leg over your left with the heel of your right foot in front of your left arch. Then, curve your right arm in toward your body while keeping your left arm out to the side. Alternatively, cross your left leg over your right and curve in your left arm.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 7 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can do third position with either your right arm and leg or your left arm and leg.</li> \n    <li>You might put your arms into third position as you perform leaps and jumps.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add fourth position when you're flexible enough to do it comfortably. For an open 4th position, place 1 foot in front of the other with your heels aligned and your toes pointed out. Lift the corresponding arm over your head with your arm curved. For a closed 4th position, cross 1 leg over the other and align your front heel with your back toes. Then, lift your arm over your head, keeping your arm curved.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 8 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bf/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Sometimes you may put your arms into fourth position during leaps and jumps.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Perform 5th position when you're ready to advance your technique. Place 1 foot in front of the other with your toes pointed out. Close your feet together with your front toe in line with your back heel and your back heel in line with your front heel. Then, lift your arms gracefully over your head, keeping them curved. This position is difficult so don't attempt it until you're flexible enough to do it.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Like with the other positions, you may do leaps and jumps with your arms in 5th position. It's okay to put your arms in 5th position when you're just a beginner. It's the footwork that's challenging.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Ballet-at-Home&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Doing Beginner Ballet Moves\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Doing-Beginner-Ballet-Moves\">Doing Beginner Ballet Moves</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-a-Plie-in-Ballet\" title=\"Do a Plie in Ballet\">Do demi pliés</a> in first position. Get into first position by standing with your legs together and your toes pointed out. Lift your arms out in front of you and form them into an oval. Bend your knees and slowly lower your body down toward the ground, keeping your heels flat on the floor. Squeeze your muscles in as you come back up. This is called a demi plié.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6a/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Pliés are pronounced as Plea-AE.</li> \n    <li>You can hold onto a ballet barre or the back of a chair for support if you need it.</li> \n    <li>After you can do a demi plié, move on to the grande pliés. It's the same move, except that you lift your heels off the floor.</li> \n    <li>This is similar to a squat but you have your heels together and your toes pointed out.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Do tendues in first position. Stand up tall with your heels together and your toes pointed out. Push your foot against the floor as you slide it out to the front, side, or back. Lift your heel to point your toe. Then, slowly lower your foot from the point down to the floor and drag your foot across the floor back to first position.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 11 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Tendues are pronounced Ton-DUE.</li> \n    <li>After you master the first position, try tendues in the other positions.</li> \n    <li>You can use a tendue to transition from first to second position. Do a tendue to the side, then lower your foot to the floor instead of bringing it back in.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Perform releves in first position. Stand tall with your heels together and your toes pointed out. Slowly lift your heels off the ground as high as you can. Pause for 2-3 seconds, then slowly lower your heels back to the floor.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 12 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/65/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Releve is pronounced “rel uh VEY.”</li> \n    <li>After you master releves in first position, try them in the other positions, as well.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Perform sautés when you're ready for a basic jump. Do a demi plié in first position with your core engaged and your upper body lifted. Then, spring off the ground and land in a demi plié. As you jump, lift your feet up heel to toe, then land by putting your feet down toe to heel.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-13.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Typically, you'll do sets of 4, 6, or 8 sautés. Pay attention to your form so that each sauté is performed correctly.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Once you master this, practice doing it in second position.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Do an échappé to shift from first to second position. Start in first position with your heels together, your toes pointed out, and your arms curved into an oval out in front of you. Do a demi plié, then leap off of the floor in a sauté. Open your legs and land in second position with your legs spread slightly wider than shoulder-width apart and your arms spread out at your sides.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-14.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 14.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1a/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-14.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-14.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>An échappé is pronounced A-sha-PAY.</li> \n    <li>Do several jumps shifting from first to second, then second to first.</li> \n    <li>You can also do an échappé to shift from fifth to second position.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Perform <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-a-Grand-Jete\" title=\"Do a Grand Jete\">grand jetés</a> to add leaps. Grand jetés are leaps where you extend 1 leg in front of your body and 1 leg behind your body. Place your arms in fourth or fifth position. Take a small hop forward with 1 leg, then leap into the air to do your grand jeté. Split your legs and extend them out straight with your toes pointed.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-15.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 15.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-15.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-15.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Jeté is pronounced Zha-TAE.</li> \n    <li>Jump as high as you can without overexerting your body or bending your knees. With practice, you'll be able to jump higher and spread your legs further.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Try <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Ballet-Dancing\" title=\"Improve Your Ballet Dancing\">grand battements</a> to incorporate kicks. A grand battement is a kick with a pointed toe and straight leg, which you can do to the front, side, or back. Put your arms in second position. Brush your foot across the floor, then lift it up into a kick. Lift your kick up as high as you can, pointing your toe. Keep your standing leg straight as you kick.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-16.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 16.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/89/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-16.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-16.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Grand battement is pronounced GROND Bot-MAH.</li> \n    <li>When you're doing a grand battement to the back, lean forward slightly but don't bend at your waist.</li> \n    <li>Try to lift your leg at least 90 degrees off the ground, but don't push yourself further than your range of motion can go. As you practice, you'll be able to lift your leg further off the ground.</li> \n    <li>You can do grand battements with your arms in other positions as you get better at ballet.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Ballet-at-Home&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Advancing Your Technique\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Advancing-Your-Technique\">Advancing Your Technique</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Watch ballet tutorials online using sites like YouTube. If you can't afford lessons, video tutorials are a great alternative. While they're not as helpful as learning from a teacher, tutorials can teach you basic ballet if you practice several days a week. Look for tutorials for moves you want to try, then follow along carefully.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-17.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 17.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/19/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-17.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-17.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Subscribe to ballet channels that you find helpful.</li> \n    <li>Keep in mind that you'll likely need lessons if you're wanting to become an advanced dancer. However, video tutorials are a great way to start and can help you enjoy ballet as a hobby.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Follow along with a video lesson. Video lessons are available on DVD or streaming sites. These lessons are taught by professional teachers, so they can teach you advanced moves. It won't be the same as working one-on-one with an instructor, but these lessons will help you develop your dancing technique.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-18.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 18.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d3/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-18.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-18.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Look for video workouts online. Watch a preview of the workout before you buy it to see if you can follow the instruction.</li> \n    <li>Pick a video that's at your level. If you're a beginner, look for a step-by-step video to help you learn.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Take classes in person for personalized instruction. Attending classes with an instructor allows you to get feedback on your form so you can make improvements. Additionally, you'll learn ballet faster and safely proceed to more advanced moves. Attending classes will also give you the opportunity to learn choreography and perform in front of an audience. Look for classes in your area by searching online.<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-19.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Do Ballet at Home Step 19.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/31/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-19.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-19.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you've been practicing at home and can't afford classes, ask the school if they have a scholarship or internship program. You may be able to earn a scholarship if you show talent and dedication, or you might be able to get a class discount if you help out around the studio.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Ballet-at-Home&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Listen to your body and respect its limits. It's okay if you can't jump high or point your toes all the way out. You'll get better with practice!</li> \n  <li>Get someone who is experienced and good at ballet to watch you. They can give you feedback on how to improve.</li> \n  <li>Ballet at home can be suitable for dancers who are only looking for basic technique, but it can't make up for real classes. Having a teacher to correct you is crucial if you're planning on getting serious about dance.</li> \n  <li>Start with the basics and work your way up to advanced dance moves.</li> \n  <li>Ballet takes years to master, so be patient and enjoy the process. You'll get better each time you practice, so keep going!</li> \n  <li>Ballet takes time and practice! If you want to get good at it, you should practice daily.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Ballet-at-Home&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Don't try to dance pointe unless you're working with an instructor. You can injure yourself if you try it on your own.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Ballet-at-Home&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ballet-Dance\" title=\"Ballet Dance\">Ballet Dance</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Stronger-Feet-for-Ballet\" title=\"Get Stronger Feet for Ballet\">Get Stronger Feet for Ballet</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Well-in-a-Ballet-Audition\" title=\"Do Well in a Ballet Audition\">Do Well in a Ballet Audition</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Ballet-Turnout\" title=\"Improve Ballet Turnout\">Improve Ballet Turnout</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Ballet-at-Home&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Do-Ballet-at-Home&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://ourpastimes.com/how-to-train-to-be-a-ballerina-at-home-12608152.html\">https://ourpastimes.com/how-to-train-to-be-a-ballerina-at-home-12608152.html</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\"   <li id=\"_note-18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Do-Ballet-at-Home#_ref-18\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 30 Sep 2020 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","linkMd5":"0ffa452d08df8ca2b0dae524731b21ed","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn42@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-01-768_c62d53d46051469f.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":26424,"destBytes":12668,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-1-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn42@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-01-768_c62d53d46051469f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/19/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-2-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn73@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-28-686_52dca26a533eed6f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-3-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn98@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-18-161_b36cb2e6bec34dca.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/11/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-4-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn5@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-18-030_0c6e90b04877b558.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/07/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-5-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn47@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-22-596_9a4794321f508cc9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c5/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-6-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn28@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-22-531_a9e376bd082a3f6c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-7-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn88@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-23-582_50885b684794d39f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bf/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-8-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn16@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-21-525_6101ce07cca134aa.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-9-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn67@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-18-063_7f5385dcd9ebb408.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6a/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn25@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-18-070_c4d8589ec0b28dc5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-11-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn41@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-18-059_4270d1eedde52901.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/65/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-12-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn3@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-24-638_c0fc8324fa9032c7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-13.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-13.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn87@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-21-590_59c61ba2f6a2638a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1a/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-14.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-14.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn82@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-25-867_699b341a2b56f267.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-15.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-15.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/89/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-16.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-16.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn13@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-24-054_1f012969fd61e9e7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/19/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-17.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-17.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn79@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-21-258_c17898b053bc590a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d3/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-18.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-18.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn88@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-20-086_d7b5da871dce9fb9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/31/Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-19.jpg/aid1480612-v4-728px-Do-Ballet-at-Home-Step-19.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn36@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-22-411_d72e59016dab7439.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214380982},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","title":"How to Make a Gratitude List","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Gratitude-List","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>If you want to feel more optimistic and lead a more mindful lifestyle, making gratitude lists might be a great exercise for you. Gratitude lists are simple to create, but they can be quite transformative if you make them a habit! You don't need any special tools to get started and it only takes a few minutes to jot down a few things you're grateful for, so give it a try. After a few weeks, you may start noticing the positive changes in your life. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-a-Gratitude-List&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-a-Gratitude-List&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Creating a Simple Gratitude List\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Creating-a-Simple-Gratitude-List\">Creating a Simple Gratitude List</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Write down at least 5 things every time you make a list. A list of 5 gratitudes per session is a pretty doable goal. If you’re having a tough time, start with 3 things instead. You can number your list, create bullet points, or simply write down 5 sentences or statements. There’s no wrong way to do this!<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Gratitude-List#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a Gratitude List Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid5964934-v4-728px-Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you’re thinking about making this a regular practice, get a dedicated notebook or notepad to keep your lists together.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Gratitude-List#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>If you prefer typing on your computer or iPad, create a document there.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Aim to be as specific as possible. Being specific forces you to examine the world around you closely and gives you the chance to be grateful for a wide variety of things. As you’re thinking of stuff for your list, try to zero in on specifics.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Gratitude-List#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a Gratitude List Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-7.jpg/aid5964934-v4-728px-Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, “I’m grateful that my friend brought me soup earlier when I was feeling under the weather” is better than “I’m grateful for my friend.”</li> \n    <li>Instead of \"I'm grateful for nice weather\" go with \"I’m grateful for the way the wind sounds when it blows leaves across my lawn\" or \"I’m grateful for the warm sun on my shoulders when I’m walking outside.\"</li> \n    <li>\"I'm grateful for my cat's soft fur and deep purr whenever I pet her\" is better than \"I'm grateful for my kitty.\"</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Include plenty of detail. Focusing on the smaller details can make your lists feel even more impactful. Don’t be afraid to elaborate with as many details as you’d like. There’s no word limit for your gratitudes and you might find that the little details bring you the most joy.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Gratitude-List#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup> For example, you might write things like:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a Gratitude List Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/19/Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-3.jpg/aid5964934-v4-728px-Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>“I'm grateful for the cool, sweet iced tea that I enjoyed with my friends today.”</li> \n    <li>”I’m grateful for the salty smell of the sea that wafts through my open window every morning.”</li> \n    <li>”I’m grateful for the juicy, home-grown tomatoes that I sliced up for my turkey sandwich today.”</li> \n    <li>\"I’m grateful for the scent of the pine trees and damp earth when I walk in the park.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Focus on experiences and people instead of objects. There’s nothing wrong with being grateful for things that you own and you can certainly write them down sometimes. Keep in mind, though, that gratitude lists tend to have more impact if you focus on your experiences and the people in your life.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Gratitude-List#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a Gratitude List Step 4 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/16/Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid5964934-v4-728px-Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, \"I'm grateful for my experience at the butterfly gardens today\" is better than \"I'm grateful for my television.\"</li> \n    <li>Something like \"I’m grateful for the scent of freshly-turned earth in my garden\" is better than \"I'm grateful for my garden.\"</li> \n    <li>\"I'm grateful that I can afford to pay for my friend's lunch when we go out together\" is better than \"I'm grateful to have money in the bank.\"</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Write freely and don't worry about spelling or grammar. Your gratitude lists are for your eyes only, so don’t get hung up on creating perfectly written sentences. Grammar and spelling don't matter, either! Write in a natural way without stopping to think of the perfect word. Just focus on what you’re grateful for and let the words flow.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Gratitude-List#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a Gratitude List Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/79/Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid5964934-v4-728px-Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Set aside 15 minutes to make your list 1-3 times a week. If you like to start your day with positivity, write your list first thing in the morning, or try doing it at night before bed. Studies show that writing a gratitude list 3 times per week has more impact than doing daily lists, so aim for that to start.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Gratitude-List#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a Gratitude List Step 11 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cb/Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid5964934-v4-728px-Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If making daily lists feel right to you, go for it! Evidence suggests that some people definitely benefit from doing this exercise every day.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Gratitude-List#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-a-Gratitude-List&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Trying Other Tools and Techniques\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Trying-Other-Tools-and-Techniques\">Trying Other Tools and Techniques</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Try writing long-form entries in a gratitude journal if you love to write. There’s no rule that says your gratitude has to be in list format! If you love journaling, feel free to write longer entries and go more in-depth. If you do this, consider limiting your journaling sessions to once a week. Research shows that overdoing it can make the process less beneficial.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Gratitude-List#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a Gratitude List Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/26/Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid5964934-v4-728px-Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You don’t need to buy a fancy gratitude journal for this, but you certainly can if you'd like.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use a gratitude app instead of paper if you're frequently on the go. Explore the gratitude journaling apps available in your smartphone’s app store and choose one that you like. Apps provide unique benefits like:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a Gratitude List Step 8 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/83/Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid5964934-v4-728px-Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Being able to make your lists anywhere and anytime. For example, you could make your list on the subway each morning.</li> \n    <li>Apps send you notification reminders. This is great if you tend to be forgetful or need extra help picking up the list-making habit.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Gratitude-List#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>List your gratitudes on sticky notes if you want to see them often. Using sticky notes is a great option if you stay pretty busy or if you want positive reminders to get you through a tough day. Write 1 thing that you’re grateful for on each sticky note and hang the notes in places around your home or workspace where you’re sure to see them.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Gratitude-List#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a Gratitude List Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d3/Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid5964934-v4-728px-Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, stick them on your bathroom mirror, inside your locker, or to your cell phone case.</li> \n    <li>Try putting a sticky note on your bedroom door so you'll see it every time you leave your room.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Gratitude-List#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Share entries with friends to make them even more special. If you can get some of your friends doing gratitude lists, you might enjoy setting aside time to get together and share a few entries with each other. For example, you might meet at a coffee shop weekly and have everyone share their favorite gratitude of the week.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Gratitude-List#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a Gratitude List Step 10 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid5964934-v4-728px-Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Another way to practice gratitude is to text a friend something you're grateful for each day.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Gratitude-List#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add inspirational quotes to your lists to boost your positivity. You might enjoy finding and writing down inspirational quotes every day as an additional gratitude exercise. You can also use quotes if you want to focus your lists on specific topics or just to reflect on them.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Gratitude-List#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make a Gratitude List Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/30/Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-8.jpg/aid5964934-v4-728px-Make-a-Gratitude-List-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-a-Gratitude-List&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Some days will be harder than others to feel gratitude and that's okay! Just stick with it and keep looking for things to be grateful about.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-a-Gratitude-List&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Things You'll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You'll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.27ll-Need\">Things You'll Need</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>A notebook, journal, paper, etc.</li> \n  <li>Pen, pencil, or marker</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\"
