\n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 02 Oct 2020 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","linkMd5":"b442fe38f29bcaf8f89afdd689c9016b","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-01-789_84564ea83947a60d.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":33879,"destBytes":21176,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-1-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn53@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-01-789_84564ea83947a60d.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e9/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-2-Version-3.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/16/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-3-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn23@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-22-483_6bfcd958ed013d1f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b8/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-4-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn43@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-28-096_a982526bad499148.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-5-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn28@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-19-195_77613788a56884ac.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/dc/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-6-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-20-334_a61fa62e49ca99e2.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-7-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn23@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-27-500_c410cb598bf3b476.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/19/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-8-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn45@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-18-129_2e5009a687828ee9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e4/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-9-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn31@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-22-578_214136e88d140a06.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d5/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn63@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-22-563_41ac34cce51ba870.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3c/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-11-Version-2.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/97/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-12-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn55@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-20-947_e22d154f70c1d908.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c9/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-13-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn70@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-28-166_99b291d9b4b84a24.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/dc/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-14-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn72@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-27-886_39660cfc3e4e56dc.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/26/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-15-Version-2.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid7596-v4-728px-Improve-Your-Hearing-Step-16-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn52@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-27-393_d4e37203a057b8cc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214380940},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","title":"How to Make Your Leather Jacket Softer","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Leather jackets look and feel great, and they can bring your outfit together in any season. Unfortunately, leather tends to stiffen up over time, especially if you don’t wear your jacket very often. Luckily, this is completely normal, and there are plenty of things you can do to fix that. In many cases, just wearing the jacket loosens it up. If this doesn’t work, then try a few steps to soften and condition the jacket so it feels brand new again! </p>\n <p><br /> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Breaking In Your Jacket\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Breaking-In-Your-Jacket\">Breaking In Your Jacket</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Wear your jacket to loosen it up. This might sound too simple to be true, but it’s not! Leather can get stiff if it’s stored away for a long time. Wearing the jacket regularly might be all you need to soften it up a bit, so take it out once in a while to break it in.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Leather Jacket Softer Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ca/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try to move around a bit while you’re wearing your jacket. Bend your elbows, raise your arms, twist back and forth, and do some other motions to soften up the leather.</li> \n    <li>There’s no firm rule on how often you should wear your jacket to soften it. Every few weeks is a good goal.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Crumple and roll around your jacket a little. Roughing up your jacket a little can help a too. Try rolling it in a ball, tossing it around, and bending it back and forth. This can work out stiffness and make your jacket more comfortable to wear.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Leather Jacket Softer Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Wear your jacket for a while after softening it up so it forms to your body.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Wet your jacket to soften it. This might sound weird, but water actually helps soften leather. If you have to go out and it’s raining lightly, wear your jacket and let it get wet. If you live in a dry area, or just don’t feel like walking around in the rain, you could get similar results with a spritz bottle. Lightly spray the jacket to moisten it. The leather will soften and contour to your body better.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Leather Jacket Softer Step 3 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/09/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This is only meant for light rain, not a heavy storm. If you do go out in heavy rain, remember to dry the jacket before putting it away.</li> \n    <li>You can also condition your jacket by wearing it out in all kinds of different weather, like snow or sun. All these different conditions will give your jacket a cool, worn look.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Move your arms around to help the wet jacket mold to you. While the jacket is wet, this is the perfect time to break it in a little. Move your arms, bend your elbows, twist around, wave, and make any other normal arm motions. As the jacket dries, it’ll naturally form around these movements, and should be less stiff in the future.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Leather Jacket Softer Step 4 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0b/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Keep the jacket on until it dries. Whether you took your jacket out in the rain or spritzed it with a spray bottle, put it on and leave it on until it dries. This way, it’ll mold to your body while it’s soft.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Leather Jacket Softer Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you got soaked in heavier rain than you expected, you can wipe the jacket down a little so you don’t get too wet.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Wipe the jacket with a dry cloth to get rid of excess water. Even if you wear the jacket until it's dry, there could still be some water droplets hiding. While some moisture is good for softening leather, storing your jacket while it’s still wet is bad for it. Always wipe the jacket down with a dry cloth or towel to get rid of any excess moisture before putting it away.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Leather Jacket Softer Step 6 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b8/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You might always want to hang your jacket to dry completely before putting it away if you got soaked in the rain.</li> \n    <li>Always dry your jacket at room temperature. Don’t use a heat source like a radiator, or you could make it stiffen again.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Conditioning the Jacket\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Conditioning-the-Jacket\">Conditioning the Jacket</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Care-For-a-Leather-Jacket#Cleaning-a-Leather-Jacket\" title=\"Care For a Leather Jacket\">Clean your jacket</a> before any conditioning treatments. No matter what conditioning you use, you don’t want any dust or dirt on the surface of the jacket.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup> You can wipe the jacket down with water and a mild detergent, or use a specialized leather cleaner. Either way, always clean the jacket before conditioning it.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Leather Jacket Softer Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Remember to dry the jacket as well. Wipe it off with a towel and hang it to dry at room temperature.</li> \n    <li>If you aren’t sure how to clean your jacket, then it’s best to bring it to a dry-cleaner to take care of.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Apply a specialized leather conditioner to your jacket. Pour a bit of conditioner onto a clean rag and rub the conditioner into your jacket. Make sure you don't miss any spots.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup> When you're done, hang it up to dry. After a good conditioning, it should be nice and soft again.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Leather Jacket Softer Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/56/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-8.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Instead of storing the jacket, you could also wear it right after. This will help it contour to your shape while it's soft.</li> \n    <li>In general, a conditioning treatment will last about 6-12 months. You might have to reapply it once or twice a year to keep your jacket soft.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Try castor oil for a cheaper solution. Instead of leather conditioner, castor oil can also work to soften leather. Pour some oil onto a clean sponge and wipe it all over the jacket. Leave the jacket for a few hours and let the oil soak in, then store it away normally.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Leather Jacket Softer Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/00/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-9.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can get castor oil at most pharmacies.</li> \n    <li>If the jacket is still too stiff, you can do this treatment more than once.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Rub petroleum jelly onto the jacket for another option. This can also help soften your leather jacket. Rub a small amount of petroleum jelly onto the jacket and let it soak in for a few hours. When you’re done, you can store the jacket normally.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Your Leather Jacket Softer Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/28/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-10.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If there is still jelly left on the jacket, you can wipe it off before putting it away.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Things You'll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You'll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.27ll-Need\">Things You'll Need</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Breaking In Your Jacket\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Breaking-In-Your-Jacket_2\">Breaking In Your Jacket</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Water</li> \n  <li>Spritz bottle</li> \n  <li>Hanger</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Conditioning the Jacket\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Conditioning-the-Jacket_2\">Conditioning the Jacket</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Clean rag</li> \n  <li>Leather conditioner</li> \n  <li>Castor oil</li> \n  <li>Petroleum jelly</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Store your jacket away from heat. Heat can shrink your jacket and make it stiff.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup></li> \n  <li>Always hang your jacket from a wide, broad-shouldered hanger. Thin hangers can stretch out the material.</li> \n  <li>Never fold your jacket when you store it. The creases can be permanent.</li> \n  <li>Avoid covering your jacket with plastic. While you might think you’re protecting your jacket with plastic covering, plastic dries out leather, so your jacket will be stiff and brittle the next time you take it out. If you want to protect your jacket, cover it with linen or cotton instead.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup></li> \n  <li>If you don’t like stiff leather jackets, then you could also get a softer type of leather. Lambskin, for example, is softer and won’t stiffen up as much.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>If you’re using any type of conditioner, always test it on the leather before rubbing it all over the jacket. Dab a little bit on a small, hidden spot and leave it there for 24 hours. Make sure the leather isn’t discolored, then you can use the conditioner.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup></li> \n  <li>Some websites recommend using coconut oil as a conditioner, but results are mixed. Manufacturers warn that this can leave a sticky or slippery film on the leather. You probably want to skip this one.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Leather\" title=\"Make Leather\">Make Leather</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Care-For-a-Leather-Jacket\" title=\"Care For a Leather Jacket\">Care For a Leather Jacket</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Clean-a-Leather-Jacket\" title=\"Clean a Leather Jacket\">Clean a Leather Jacket</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 01 Oct 2020 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ca/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"dae3fb4949173b9cfda96205803b3ae5","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn80@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-01-844_111ff00ca6a210ed.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":69693,"destBytes":39358,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ca/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-1-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn80@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-01-844_111ff00ca6a210ed.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-2-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn17@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-18-040_7bd38509d21b69f7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/09/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-3-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn11@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-19-939_e06d72603af383a5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0b/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-4-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn43@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-19-301_2b2646db3d7c62ad.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-5-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn84@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-24-452_16dfa6a29bc989a7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b8/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-6-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn72@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-21-993_35dedf11bcdd9d01.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-7-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn36@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-20-370_9045d426406230a9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/56/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-8.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn96@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-21-361_fe7a419ec79c4686.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/00/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-9.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn88@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-19-403_4632a1d63efa2111.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/28/Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-10.jpg/aid664904-v4-728px-Make-Your-Leather-Jacket-Softer-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn67@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-22-657_aa6decd6f3d87581.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214380899},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","title":"How to Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Feeling under-appreciated, or completely unappreciated, by your partner is bad for your relationship and your own wellbeing. While you can’t force your significant other to appreciate you more, having calm, clear, and frequent conversations on the subject may lead to improvement. It’s also important for you to show appreciation for yourself and your life—this is something you can control! </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Sharing Your Feelings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Sharing-Your-Feelings\">Sharing Your Feelings</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Use “I” statements to clearly but gently share how you feel. Never assume that your partner knows you feel under-appreciated—tell them! When you do tell them, though, don’t use accusatory “you” statements. Instead, relate how you are feeling by relying on “I” statements.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5f/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-1.jpg/aid12170837-v4-728px-Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, instead of, “You don’t appreciate any of the work I do around the house,” try, “I don’t feel appreciated when the work I do around the house goes unnoticed.”</li> \n    <li>Do your best to remain calm and composed as you share your feelings. It’s best, when possible, to wait for an opportunity when both of you have the time and the right attitude for a true conversation.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Identify consequences without begging or demanding. After using one or several “I” statements to express your feelings of under-appreciation, follow up with one or more “I” statements on potential consequences. “Consequences” doesn’t necessarily mean a “fix this or we’re through” ultimatum—although that may be the case sometimes—but you do need to clearly identify where things may be headed.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/93/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-2.jpg/aid12170837-v4-728px-Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example: “I have feelings of resentment because of the lack of appreciation, and I’m worried that our relationship will be permanently damaged.”</li> \n    <li>Or: “I think this relationship may not be worth continuing if things remain the same.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Listen closely and give your partner a chance to respond. It’s hard to predict how your partner will respond, but it’s important that you give them a chance to do so. They might be surprised, remorseful, apologetic, offended, or even angry. So long as they do not create a threatening or unhealthy situation, let them have their say.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-3.jpg/aid12170837-v4-728px-Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don’t interrupt, even if you vehemently disagree with their perspective on the situation—for instance, if they insist that they “show you way more appreciation” than you ever show them.</li> \n    <li>Unless they go completely off the rails, consider cutting your partner some slack on their initial response. It can be very difficult to hear that your partner doesn’t think you appreciate them.</li> \n    <li>If you make it clear that you’re listening and that you respect their point of view, it’s more likely that you’ll be able to move forward in a positive direction.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Support your partner if they express a desire to improve. This is the best-case scenario, so be ready to help make it happen! If your partner apologizes and pledges to do better, validate their goal and offer your support in tangible ways.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/92/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-4.jpg/aid12170837-v4-728px-Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example: “I accept your apology and I’m so happy that you’re committed to making changes. Can we talk about some strategies we both can use to improve how we show appreciation and gratitude?”</li> \n    <li>If they express a desire to seek outside help, such as by seeing a counselor, you might show your support by helping them to find a therapist or by shuffling your schedule so they can make their appointments.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Keep the lines of communication open as an ongoing process. Don’t expect to fix this problem in a single conversation! If your partner is willing, commit to openly and frequently talking about this issue and all the others that will inevitably arise in your relationship.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-5.jpg/aid12170837-v4-728px-Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example: “I’m really glad we talked like this, and I think it might really help. Can we set aside some time each week to talk about our feelings?”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Follow through on the consequences if nothing changes. Unfortunately, your partner may be unwilling to commit to positive change. If so, it’s important that you stick to the consequences you laid out when you raised the issue of feeling unappreciated. Doing so will be extremely difficult if it means ending the relationship, but you owe it to yourself to prioritize your emotional health.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9e/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-6.jpg/aid12170837-v4-728px-Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>It’s sometimes possible, although challenging, to sustain a reasonably healthy relationship even when you feel under-appreciated. Be honest with yourself about the costs and benefits of continuing the relationship versus ending it.</li> \n    <li>If you’re experiencing physical or emotional abuse alongside a lack of appreciation, get out of the relationship for your own safety and wellbeing.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Encouraging Appreciation\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Encouraging-Appreciation\">Encouraging Appreciation</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Model the behavior you want to see by showing appreciation. You’re almost certain to feel as though you show your partner lots of appreciation, but step back and make an honest assessment. Is your resentment about not being appreciated causing you to withhold appreciation? Can you do more to model the appreciative behavior you desire from your partner?<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/da/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-7.jpg/aid12170837-v4-728px-Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>“Punishing” your partner by not showing appreciation is unlikely to help and more likely to make things worse. Instead of contributing to a downward spiral, aim to raise the bar on showing appreciation.</li> \n    <li>Showing appreciation is easy! (And that’s why it’s so frustrating that your partner doesn’t do it!) While a simple, sincere “thank you” can go a long way, try using the word “appreciate” when possible: “I really appreciate your helping me with the laundry today.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Show appreciation by (sometimes, not always) putting your partner’s needs first. A healthy, rewarding relationship requires give-and-take, compromise, and sacrifice. Part of modeling the appreciation you hope to receive involves putting your partner’s needs in front of your own. Keep in mind, though, that it is not desirable or healthy for you to do this all the time—you deserve to prioritize your own needs as well!<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ed/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-8.jpg/aid12170837-v4-728px-Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Putting your partner first may be as simple as letting them choose where to go for dinner. Or, it might be a major decision, like relocating for their career. If you’re feeling unappreciated by your partner, though, don’t feel obligated to make life-altering sacrifices until they prove capable of making positive changes!</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Reward honest appreciation genuinely and specifically. Positive reinforcement works better than negative reinforcement, no matter if it’s for a child, a pet, or an under-appreciative significant other! Instead of criticizing instances when they don’t show appreciation, point out and praise every single instance when they do. They’ll begin to crave this praise and will do what it takes to earn more of it!<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6d/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-9.jpg/aid12170837-v4-728px-Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Specifically point out what the other person did that’s so praiseworthy: “I appreciate so much that you took the time to drive my mother to her doctor’s appointment today, Devon.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Express and reward appreciation in ways that suit each of you. Voicing your appreciation isn’t the only way to show it, and, according to the concept of “love languages,” you or your partner may respond better to other methods. Talk with your partner about which signs of appreciation most resonate with you. The 5 “love languages” are as follows:<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e9/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-10.jpg/aid12170837-v4-728px-Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li><i>Words of affection</i>. Voicing appreciation is most effective.</li> \n    <li><i>Quality time</i>. Show appreciation by spending time doing something together that the other person really enjoys.</li> \n    <li><i>Acts of service</i>. Take actions that demonstrate appreciation.</li> \n    <li><i>Physical contact</i>. Depending on the person, this can range from gentle cuddling to vigorous bedroom activity!</li> \n    <li><i>Receiving gifts</i>. A thoughtful, personalized gift shows appreciation, but the act of giving the gift is at least as important.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Do a list-making exercise about appreciation with your partner. This is a variation on a couples counseling exercise, with “appreciated” subbed in for “loved.” Individually write up and share a list of several statements that start as follows: “I feel appreciated when you….” Then, write up and share several statements that start like this: “I would feel more appreciated if you….” After sharing your lists, take turns standing up and sharing what you will do to better show appreciation to your partner.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a7/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-11.jpg/aid12170837-v4-728px-Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example: “I feel appreciated when you volunteer to do the dishes after I make dinner.”</li> \n    <li>And: “I would feel more appreciated if you said “thank you” sincerely more often.”</li> \n    <li>Then: “I will show more appreciation to you by respecting your need to relax for a little while after work.”</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Appreciating Yourself\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Appreciating-Yourself\">Appreciating Yourself</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Take time each day to identify things you’re grateful for. Think of this as the first part of a 2-part “appreciation exercise.” Take some time to yourself to think up (or write down) around 5-10 things you appreciate in your life each day.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8f/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-12.jpg/aid12170837-v4-728px-Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You might, for example, identify your appreciation for your health, your family, your pet, your job, and the safe community you live in.</li> \n    <li>Taking the time to think about what you appreciate helps get you in the right frame of mind to recognize why and for what you deserve appreciation.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Remind yourself daily that you are worthy of appreciation. Make this part 2 of your appreciation exercise. Now that you’ve thought of some things that you appreciate, write, speak, or think to yourself about why you deserve appreciation. Focus both on why you are inherently worthy of appreciation, as well as particular actions that deserve to be appreciated.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-13.jpg/aid12170837-v4-728px-Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, you might say something like the following to yourself: “I appreciate the good in my life and in those around me, and the good in me deserves appreciation as well.”</li> \n    <li>Then, you might add something like this: “I am worthy of appreciation because I try hard to keep our home running smoothly.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Make time for a regular self-care routine that calms and restores you. Taking some “me time” when you need it isn’t selfish. Consider scheduling a regular time for self-care activities, but also be ready to take some time for self-care when you need it. Things like meditation, yoga, nature walks, spa days, crafting, gardening, fixing things, soaking in the tub, or reading a good book might work—find the best options for you!<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-14.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More Step 14.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-14.jpg/aid12170837-v4-728px-Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-14.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you get resistance from your partner, be clear but caring: “I need this time to myself to relax and recharge, so I can be more present and positive when we’re together.”</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Look for ways you can improve without blaming yourself. There’s a fine line here—don’t tell yourself that it’s your fault that you’re not being appreciated! That said, do reflect on things that are under your control and which may be getting in the way of the appreciation you deserve. Work to make positive changes, and remember to appreciate yourself for your efforts!<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-15.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More Step 15.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/76/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-15.jpg/aid12170837-v4-728px-Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-15.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, do you sometimes possibly misinterpret efforts by your partner to show at least some amount of appreciation? If so, can you work to be more open to accepting appreciation in a broader sense, while at the same time being clear with your partner that you need to feel appreciated?</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Build up your self-appreciation with professional guidance. At the end of the day, you can’t control whether or not your partner gives you the appreciation you deserve. But you can control whether you show yourself this appreciation, and working with a therapist may help you achieve self-appreciation.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-16.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Your Significant Other to Appreciate You More Step 16.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e1/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-16.jpg/aid12170837-v4-728px-Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More-Step-16.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Talk to your doctor about therapist recommendations. Look for a therapist with experience dealing with patients in situations similar to yours.</li> \n    <li>Your therapist might show you visualization techniques, cognitive behavioral therapy (CBI) approaches, and other methods to build your self-esteem and self-appreciation.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Accept that your relationship is unique, which means that it won’t look exactly the same or require the same solutions as anyone else’s. That said, some degree of mutual appreciation is essential to a healthy, stable, happy relationship.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Get-Your-Significant-Other-to-Appreciate-You-More&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap
