mb/1/10/Be-Organized-in-School-Step-15-Version-6.jpg/aid83324-v4-728px-Be-Organized-in-School-Step-15-Version-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn7@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-22-995_fe37d551900f26da.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/05/Be-Organized-in-School-Step-16-Version-6.jpg/aid83324-v4-728px-Be-Organized-in-School-Step-16-Version-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn37@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-26-507_69b489bae51f7649.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/48/Be-Organized-in-School-Step-17-Version-7.jpg/aid83324-v4-728px-Be-Organized-in-School-Step-17-Version-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn10@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-28-702_3beef79c12084b33.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214380864},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","title":"How to Share a Zoom Meeting Link","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>This wikiHow will teach you how to share a Zoom meeting link while you're in the meeting as well as a scheduled meeting link. To be able to share an on-going meeting's link, you'll need to use the desktop client; to share a scheduled meeting's link, you can use either the desktop client or a web browser. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Sharing a Scheduled Meeting's Link\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Sharing-a-Scheduled-Meeting's-Link\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Sharing-a-Scheduled-Meeting.27s-Link\">Sharing a Scheduled Meeting's Link</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Go to <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.zoom.com\">https://www.zoom.com</a> and sign in. Click <b>Sign in</b> in the top right corner and enter your credentials or click to use Facebook, Google, or SSO to sign in.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Share a Zoom Meeting Link Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-1.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"544\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you prefer to use the desktop client, you can; however, buttons will be in different places than on the website.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Click . You'll see this in the vertical menu on the left side of the page if you're using a web browser.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Share a Zoom Meeting Link Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/79/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-2.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"544\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you're using the desktop client, you'll see \"Meetings\" in the horizontal menu at the top of the window.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Click the meeting you want to share (web only). The \"Upcoming\" tab should automatically load with all your scheduled upcoming meetings.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Share a Zoom Meeting Link Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0d/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-3.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you're using the desktop client, you don't have to do this step since all your scheduled meetings and their details are listed on the \"Meetings\" page.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Click . It's to the right of the \"Invite Link\" header on the website.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Share a Zoom Meeting Link Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/95/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-4.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>A window will pop up with the invitation's details if you're using the website.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Click (web only). This will copy all the information in the text box to your clipboard.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Share a Zoom Meeting Link Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-5.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"543\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you're using the desktop client, this is an automatic process and you won't see this step.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Share your copied invite. You can paste that invite in an email or in a Facebook Message with your friends so they can join the meeting.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Share a Zoom Meeting Link Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e1/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-6.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Sharing an On-Going Meeting's Link in the Desktop Client\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Sharing-an-On-Going-Meeting's-Link-in-the-Desktop-Client\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Sharing-an-On-Going-Meeting.27s-Link-in-the-Desktop-Client\">Sharing an On-Going Meeting's Link in the Desktop Client</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Open Zoom and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-PC-or-Mac\" title=\"Join a Zoom Meeting on PC or Mac\">join a meeting</a>. This application icon looks like a video camera inside a blue circle that you can find in your Start menu or in the Applications folder in Finder.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Share a Zoom Meeting Link Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e4/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-7.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"545\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You might have an invite to a meeting in your email or have a link or code that you can use to join an ongoing meeting. Refer to <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-PC-or-Mac\" title=\"Join a Zoom Meeting on PC or Mac\">How to Join a Zoom Meeting on PC or Mac</a> for more information.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Click . It's with an icon that looks like two people centered at the bottom of your screen.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Share a Zoom Meeting Link Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7b/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-8.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"544\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Click . This icon is located in the bottom right corner of your screen.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Share a Zoom Meeting Link Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/53/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-9.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"545\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Choose a method of sharing. You can click <b>\"Copy Invite Link,\"</b> <b>\"Copy Invitation,\"</b> <b>\"Email,\"</b> or <b>\"Contacts.\"</b>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Share a Zoom Meeting Link Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/18/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-10.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"548\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The option for \"Copy invitation\" will copy the entire meeting's detailed information whereas \"Copy Invite Link\" will only copy the URL for the meeting.</li> \n    <li>If you choose \"Email,\" you'll next have to choose which email service you'd like to use (the default email you have set up, Gmail, or Yahoo). When you choose an email service, you'll be prompted to log in, then an auto-generated email will open for you to add recipients to in order to share the meeting link.</li> \n    <li>Click the \"Contacts\" tab to share the meeting with contacts you have on Zoom. Simply click to select them in your contacts list, then click <b>Invite</b>. <sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Share your copied invite. You can paste that invite in an email or in a Facebook Message with your friends so they can join the meeting.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Share a Zoom Meeting Link Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/93/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-11.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Create-a-Zoom-Account\" title=\"Create a Zoom Account\">Create a Zoom Account</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362183-Inviting-others-to-join-a-meeting\">https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362183-Inviting-others-to-join-a-meeting</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362183-Inviting-others-to-join-a-meeting\">https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362183-Inviting-others-to-join-a-meeting</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 08 Oct 2020 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-1.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"d8af3d7c081208b5bfc92b29760053a3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn27@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-01-801_7823f0de42484058.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":544,"sourceBytes":31670,"destBytes":16038,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-1.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn27@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-01-801_7823f0de42484058.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/79/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-2.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn75@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-21-941_76490ba9ee89c04c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0d/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-3.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn32@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-20-765_33241141f11996d7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/95/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-4.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn72@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-25-883_4a1bb1516c8367a5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-5.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn8@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-19-678_b4a65506636b1939.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e1/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-6.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn84@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-22-836_e1580bf88df988c6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e4/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-7.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn7@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-22-237_b412fb2a89a401c9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7b/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-8.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn83@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-28-457_5e672a792e4195a7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/53/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-9.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn3@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-19-056_90814aebd06b3233.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/18/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-10.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn91@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-24-482_cc18d5507b7ec9ba.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/93/Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-11.jpg/aid12157089-v4-728px-Share-a-Zoom-Meeting-Link-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn48@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-21-806_7f71003a78342a38.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214380860},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","title":"How to Eat Healthy","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Changing how you eat is a major step towards being healthier. There’s more to a balanced diet than simply eating your fruits and vegetables, so knowing what foods to look out for will help you create a nutrition plan that strengthens your body and makes you feel better overall. Proper nutrition can give you more energy and can provide lots of other benefits, such as lower blood pressure, lower cholesterol, and less stress. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Eat-Healthy&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Eat-Healthy&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Creating a Balanced Diet\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Creating-a-Balanced-Diet\">Creating a Balanced Diet</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Eat 225-325 grams (1-2.5 cups) of complex carbs each day. Complex carbs are slowly digested and absorbed by the body, which means they provide more nutrients and keep you full longer. It’s a good idea to reach for complex carbs, which include whole-grain flour, sweet potatoes, oats, and/or brown rice. These healthy carbs are usually higher in vitamins and other nutrients than simple carbs, like white bread and white rice.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Eat-Healthy-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Choose wheat, multigrain, or rye bread and whole wheat pasta.</li> \n    <li>If you like oatmeal for breakfast, pick whole oats.</li> \n    <li>Depending on your individual needs, your doctor might recommend that you eat fewer carbs.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Fill at least half of your plate with vegetables to get 5 servings a day. Veggies are packed with nutrients and are surprisingly easy to sneak into your diet. Consider eating dark leafy greens like kale, collard greens, mustard greens, and Swiss chard. Create a simple sauté with olive oil, garlic, and a little salt and pepper, which will be a surprisingly tasty meal as well as a nutritious one.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/49/Eat-Healthy-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Add spinach to a smoothie in the morning to add a serving of leafy greens that you won’t even notice.</li> \n    <li>The next time you make tacos, try throwing in some peppers and onions.</li> \n    <li>Pasta dishes are a great place to add extra veggies. Toss some mushrooms in with your spaghetti or lasagna.</li> \n    <li>Don’t be afraid to try new foods. If you think you don’t like vegetables, just try another kind.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Eat 2-3 servings of fruit each day for extra vitamins. Fruits are good for you and can be a delicious treat. You can grab an apple or pear as a mid-morning snack, or look for ways to integrate fruit into other dishes.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 3 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Eat-Healthy-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Add berries or a banana to your morning cereal or oatmeal.</li> \n    <li>Fresh fruits taste great in salads. Try adding some dried cranberries for a flavor boost or combining a pear with goat cheese over some leafy greens.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Eat healthy, lean proteins to get more energy. Protein helps you build muscle and gives you a steady supply of energy throughout the day. Choose lean proteins to avoid adding too much fat to your diet. There are great choices that include meat and plant-based proteins. There's an ongoing debate about how much protein you need each day, so check with your doctor or use an online calculator for specific amounts. Some examples of healthy proteins include:<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 4 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Eat-Healthy-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Lean cuts of chicken, pork, and turkey</li> \n    <li>Fish, such as salmon, white fish, and tuna</li> \n    <li>Nuts like cashews, almonds, and pistachios</li> \n    <li>Beans, such as black beans, pinto beans, and cannellini beans</li> \n    <li>Lentils and chickpeas</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Choose healthy fats for 20-35% of your daily calories. You need to consume fat for your body to function correctly. However, it's important to choose the right kind of fats. Read food labels and select foods that are low in saturated fats. Typically, you should aim to eat less than 20-30 grams of saturated fat each day. Choose foods like avocados, salmon, tuna, and nut butter to get the healthy fats that you need.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Eat-Healthy-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Monounsaturated fats and omega-3 fatty acids are good fats, which you should try to consume regularly. They help lower the \"bad cholesterol\" in your body by raising \"good cholesterol\".</li> \n    <li>Foods that are high in fatty acids are olive oil, nuts, fish oil, and various seed oils. Adding these \"good\" fats to your weekly diet can lower your cholesterol and reduce your risk of heart disease.</li> \n    <li>Avoid trans fats and saturated fats. Trans fats, also known as partially hydrogenated oils, are a form of unsaturated fat commonly found in processed foods. Consuming them raises your risk of heart disease.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Limit your salt intake to reduce sodium. A little bit of sodium is good for you and you can get enough just by eating a healthy diet. Avoid adding salt to your food after it is prepared and try to steer clear of packaged foods that can contain a lot of extra sodium.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 6 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/df/Eat-Healthy-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Instead of flavoring your food with salt, try adding fresh herbs like cilantro, chives, or dill for a big flavor boost.</li> \n    <li>Canned vegetables can contain a lot of sodium so reach for fresh or frozen whenever possible.</li> \n    <li>Talk to your doctor about how much salt is okay for you to have. If you have high blood pressure or heart issues, you might need to limit your intake even more.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Drink at least 11.5 cups (2.7 L) of water each day. Water is essential for good health, so make sure to drink at least 11.5 (2.7 L) cups a day if you are a woman and 15.5 cups (3.7 L) if you are a man. Try keeping track of how much water you drink so that you know you are getting enough. Try getting a water bottle that is clearly marked so it’s easy to measure. Another good idea is to drink before you even get thirsty. That will help you make sure that you don’t get dehydrated.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 7 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0d/Eat-Healthy-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Carry water with you so you can easily pick it up when you're thirsty.</li> \n    <li>If you do a tough workout or spend time outside on a hot day, make sure to replenish your body by drinking extra water that day.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Eat-Healthy&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Eating Mindfully\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Eating-Mindfully\">Eating Mindfully</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Talk to your doctor before drastically changing your diet. Your doctor is a great resource, so don’t be afraid to ask them for help. Check-in with your doctor about what type of diet will be best for you. Everyone’s health and body are different, so ask them to give you some ideas tailored for you.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 8 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Eat-Healthy-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Your doctor can also help you figure out a healthy weight and suggest an exercise plan if you are interested in that.</li> \n    <li>Always check with your doctor before taking vitamins or supplements, too.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Eat when you are hungry instead of when you are emotional. It’s normal to turn to food when you are experiencing certain emotions. The key is to pay attention to why you are eating and try to do it only when you are actually hungry. If you find yourself eating more than you would like, start writing down when you eat and how you feel so you can track patterns.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 9 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/ba/Eat-Healthy-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, maybe you eat when you are stressed or sad. Try to find a relaxing activity that can serve as a replacement. Try taking a nice walk or listening to a good podcast instead of reaching for a snack.</li> \n    <li>If you use food as a way to celebrate, that’s totally fine to do in moderation. If you find that you are overindulging during happy times, try to celebrate by treating yourself to something other than food. Maybe you could book a trip or buy yourself a new pair of shoes.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Enjoy your food and eat slowly. It takes some time for your stomach to tell your brain that it's full. Circumvent the problem by consuming your food slower. That way, by the time you get the message and start feeling satisfied, you haven't consumed extra food. As a bonus, eating more slowly can help you really savor and appreciate your meal.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 10 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Eat-Healthy-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Chew each mouthful 20 to 40 times to fully release all of the flavors.</li> \n    <li>Slow yourself down by waiting 5 or 10 minutes between each course if you’re eating a large meal.</li> \n    <li>Drink a full glass of water throughout your meal. Stopping for sips will slow your eating, as well as help you feel more full.</li> \n    <li>Put your fork down between bites. This is a physical reminder to finish the food in your mouth before taking another bite.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Focus on how each type of food makes you feel after eating. Pay attention to how you feel after each meal. You might start noticing that eating something with a lot of fat, like a cheeseburger, makes you feel overly full and sluggish. Or you might realize that eating a protein-packed salad makes you feel energized. Try writing down how you feel after each meal so that you can remember these sensations.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 11 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9a/Eat-Healthy-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If a food leaves you feeling kind of icky, look for a healthier substitute. For example, swap out your deep-dish sausage pizza for a veggie pizza on a thin, whole wheat crust.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Feel more connected to food by paying attention to where it comes from. This will help you be more mindful, which can lead to a healthy relationship with food. The more you pay attention to how your food is made and where it comes from, the more likely you are to make healthy choices. Try to buy fresh, local food if your location and budget allows for that.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 12 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cb/Eat-Healthy-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, if you have a choice between local tomatoes and tomatoes shipped from a long distance, choose local. You might feel good that you’re supporting your local economy and your produce will likely be fresher.</li> \n    <li>Read labels. If you don’t recognize many of the main ingredients, try to pick something else. The simplest food with the fewest preservatives is often the healthiest choice.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Eat-Healthy&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Planning Your Meals\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Planning-Your-Meals\">Planning Your Meals</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Eat breakfast, even if you’re not really hungry. Eating breakfast gets your metabolism going and keeps it active throughout the morning. This will keep you energized throughout the morning. Skipping breakfast might leave you famished by lunch, causing you to binge as a way to compensate. Plan your breakfasts for the week in advance so that it’s easy to grab a simple, healthy meal to start your day.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 13 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/03/Eat-Healthy-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>A small breakfast is better than no breakfast. If you don't feel up to a full meal, at least drink some water and eat a piece of fruit, a protein bar, or a piece of whole-wheat toast.</li> \n    <li>Try some make-ahead options like a fruit and yogurt parfait, a frittata, or overnight oats.</li> \n    <li>Avoid skipping breakfast on the day of an important exam, job interview, or another critical event, where you may be distracted by your hunger or not have enough energy for your brain to work to its full potential.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Eat several small meals and snacks throughout the day. Try eating three meals per day (breakfast, lunch, and dinner), with two snacks in between. Doing this allows you to eat slightly less at your meals, giving your body a more manageable amount of food to digest, and keeps your blood sugar at a consistent level throughout the day. A good plan for the day might look like:<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 14 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/da/Eat-Healthy-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Breakfast: A smoothie with protein, fruits, and vegetables.</li> \n    <li>Morning snack: An apple with nut butter or a small portion of cheese.</li> \n    <li>Lunch: A salad with lots of veggies, lean proteins, and a grain like quinoa or farro.</li> \n    <li>Afternoon snack: Hummus, bell peppers, and whole wheat pita.</li> \n    <li>Dinner: Grilled or baked fish, a sweet potato, and roasted broccoli.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Cut back on <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stop-Eating-Meat\" title=\"Stop Eating Meat\">eating meat</a> and focus on plants. There are lots of health benefits to eating a more veggie-forward diet. Even if you don’t want to cut back too much, you could try doing Meatless Monday, which is an international campaign that encourages people to give up eating meat one day per week. Most people already have enough protein in their diets, but check with your doctor if you have concerns.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-15.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 15.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0d/Eat-Healthy-Step-15.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-15.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Sub mushrooms for meat in pasta dishes to get a meaty texture with less fat.</li> \n    <li>Try using black beans for tacos or burritos instead of meat for great flavor and added protein.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Meal-Plan\" title=\"Meal Plan\">Plan your meals</a> in advance to stay on track. Write down what meals and snacks you want to eat for the week. Planning in advance can help you make healthy choices instead of impulsively reaching for junk food when you are hungry. Try to choose meals that use similar ingredients (to make shopping easier), but that have enough variety so that you won’t get bored. If you can, try to prep some of your meals in advance so that you always have a healthy option handy.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-16-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 16 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/87/Eat-Healthy-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-16-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You might plan to make veggie fajitas one night, and then use the leftover vegetables in a Mexican-inspired salad the next day, for example.</li> \n    <li>Wash and cut up all of your produce for the week right after you get home from the store. That way, you’ll always have a healthy snack to grab.</li> \n    <li>Try boiling several hard-boiled eggs at the beginning of the week so that you can have a grab and go breakfast or a protein to add to salads.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Take a list to the grocery store and stick to it. Write down what you need for your meal plan so that you have all of your essentials. When you go to the store, only buy what’s on your list. This can help you cut down on impulse items, like snacks and sweets.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Eat-Healthy-Step-17.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Eat Healthy Step 17.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/02/Eat-Healthy-Step-17.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-17.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don’t go to the grocery store when you’re hungry. You’re more likely to overbuy.</li> \n    <li>Try using an app on your phone to store your list. That way you are less likely to forget your list at home or in the car.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Eat-Healthy&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Help Selecting Healthy Foods and Meals\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Help-Selecting-Healthy-Foods-and-Meals\">Help Selecting Healthy Foods and Meals</span></h3> \n <div id=\"sd_container\">\n  <div class=\"sd_thumb\">\n   <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sample/Healthy-vs.-Unhealthy-Food-Choices\"><img class=\"whcdn\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" data-src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Healthy-vs.-Unhealthy-Food-Choices_sample.png/340px-Healthy-vs.-Unhealthy-Food-Choices_sample.png\" id=\"5f7fd93a55362\" /><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('5f7fd93a55362')</script>\n    <noscript>\n     <img class=\"whcdn\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Healthy-vs.-Unhealthy-Food-Choices_sample.png/340px-Healthy-vs.-Unhealthy-Food-Choices_sample.png\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" />\n    </noscript><span>Healthy vs. Unhealthy Food Choices</span></a>\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"sd_thumb\">\n   <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sample/Healthy-Weekly-Meal-Plan\"><img class=\"whcdn\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" data-src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Healthy-Weekly-Meal-Plan_sample.png/340px-Healthy-Weekly-Meal-Plan_sample.png\" id=\"5f7fd93a55d43\" /><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('5f7fd93a55d43')</script>\n    <noscript>\n     <img class=\"whcdn\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Healthy-Weekly-Meal-Plan_sample.png/340px-Healthy-Weekly-Meal-Plan_sample.png\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" />\n    </noscript><span>Healthy Weekly Meal Plan</span></a>\n  </div>\n  <div class=\"sd_thumb\">\n   <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sample/Healthy-Vegetarian-Weekly-Meal-Plan\"><img class=\"whcdn\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" data-src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Healthy-Vegetarian-Weekly-Meal-Plan_sample.png/340px-Healthy-Vegetarian-Weekly-Meal-Plan_sample.png\" id=\"5f7fd93a566d9\" /><script>WH.shared.addScrollLoadItem('5f7fd93a566d9')</script>\n    <noscript>\n     <img class=\"whcdn\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Healthy-Vegetarian-Weekly-Meal-Plan_sample.png/340px-Healthy-Vegetarian-Weekly-Meal-Plan_sample.png\" width=\"340\" height=\"440\" />\n    </noscript><span>Healthy Vegetarian Weekly Meal Plan</span></a>\n  </div>\n </div> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Eat-Healthy&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Eat before you shop so you can focus on your grocery list without having any unnecessary cravings.</li> \n  <li>Cravings for junk food usually stop after about 2 weeks of eating healthy.</li> \n  <li>Try to lower your processed junk food consumption (chips, cookies, bread, crackers).</li> \n  <li>Make sure there isn't a lot of unhealthy food in your house that can tempt you. Give or throw away the foods you shouldn't eat.</li> \n  <li>Try making your own flavorings instead of buying unhealthy sauce for flavor.</li> \n  <li>Eat smaller portions, use a smaller plate to encourage smaller portions.</li> \n  <li>Instead of limiting foods, replace them. If you like sweet cookies, try sweet strawberries or blueberries. If you like chips, try unsalted popcorn. Think about all the foods you can eat, instead of dwelling on the foods you are trying not to eat.</li> \n  <li>Limit your alcohol consumption to 1-2 drinks per day, if you drink.</li> \n  <li>Try to stay away from fast food. It often has high levels of sodium and saturated fat.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Eat-Healthy&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Healthier-Without-a-Dramatic-Lifestyle-Change\" title=\"Be Healthier Without a Dramatic Lifestyle Change\">Be Healthier Without a Dramatic Lifestyle Change</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-an-App-to-Budget-While-Grocery-Shopping\" title=\"Use an App to Budget While Grocery Shopping\">Use an App to Budget While Grocery Shopping</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Eat-Healthy&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Eat-Healthy&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/nutrition-and-healthy-eating/in-depth/carbohydrates/art-20045705\">https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/nutrition-and-healthy-eating/in-depth/carbohydrates/art-20045705</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.hhs.gov/fitness/eat-healthy/how-to-eat-healthy/index.html\">https://www.hhs.gov/fitness/eat-healthy/how-to-eat-healthy/index.html</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-3\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.nhs.uk/live-well/eat-well/eight-tips-for-healthy-eating/\">https://www.nhs.uk/live-well/eat-well/eight-tips-for-healthy-eating/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-4\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.health.harvard.edu/blog/how-much-protein-do-you-need-every-day-201506188096\">https://www.health.harvard.edu/blog/how-much-protein-do-you-need-every-day-201506188096</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-5\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://my.clevelandclinic.org/health/articles/11208-fat-what-you-need-to-know\">https://my.clevelandclinic.org/health/articles/11208-fat-what-you-need-to-know</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-6\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.heart.org/en/healthy-living/healthy-eating/eat-smart/sodium?uid=1938\">https://www.heart.org/en/healthy-living/healthy-eating/eat-smart/sodium?uid=1938</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-7\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.mayoclinichealthsystem.org/hometown-health/speaking-of-health/water-essential-to-your-body\">https://www.mayoclinichealthsystem.org/hometown-health/speaking-of-health/water-essential-to-your-body</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-8\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://familydoctor.org/what-you-should-know-before-you-start-a-weight-loss-plan/\">https://familydoctor.org/what-you-should-know-before-you-start-a-weight-loss-plan/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-9\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.helpguide.org/articles/diets/mindful-eating.htm\">https://www.helpguide.org/articles/diets/mindful-eating.htm</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-10\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.health.harvard.edu/staying-healthy/8-steps-to-mindful-eating\">https://www.health.harvard.edu/staying-healthy/8-steps-to-mindful-eating</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-11\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.helpguide.org/articles/diets/mindful-eating.htm\">https://www.helpguide.org/articles/diets/mindful-eating.htm</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-12\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.helpguide.org/articles/diets/mindful-eating.htm\">https://www.helpguide.org/articles/diets/mindful-eating.htm</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-13\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.betterhealth.vic.gov.au/health/healthyliving/breakfast\">https://www.betterhealth.vic.gov.au/health/healthyliving/breakfast</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-14\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://health.clevelandclinic.org/heart-health-eat-breakfast-frequent-meals/\">https://health.clevelandclinic.org/heart-health-eat-breakfast-frequent-meals/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-15\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/nutrition-and-healthy-eating/in-depth/meatless-meals/art-20048193\">https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/nutrition-and-healthy-eating/in-depth/meatless-meals/art-20048193</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-16\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.beaumont.org/health-wellness/blogs/health-benefits-of-meal-planning\">https://www.beaumont.org/health-wellness/blogs/health-benefits-of-meal-planning</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Healthy#_ref-17\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.choosemyplate.gov/eathealthy/budget/budget-grocery-list\">https://www.choosemyplate.gov/eathealthy/budget/budget-grocery-list</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 07 Oct 2020 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Eat-Healthy-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","linkMd5":"55ad644547f806adecd3211d8bc093a6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn3@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-16-268_607222e32f24393d.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":49444,"destBytes":37526,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Eat-Healthy-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-1-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn3@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-16-268_607222e32f24393d.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/49/Eat-Healthy-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-2-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn64@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-25-639_c002d68c8499ae8c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Eat-Healthy-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-3-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn55@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-28-149_bbef080c45c79e93.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Eat-Healthy-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-4-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn99@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-26-988_b6631870f1763290.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Eat-Healthy-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-5-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn95@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-22-075_a8b45c96c40c81bf.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/df/Eat-Healthy-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-6-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-19-166_4ac22b474758c528.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0d/Eat-Healthy-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-7-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn75@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-20-343_b84c8f32489b8e97.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/Eat-Healthy-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-8-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn25@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-28-662_33ba17c75b44c557.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/ba/Eat-Healthy-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-9-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn99@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-22-170_948ece1eae2d07c9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Eat-Healthy-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-10-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn62@2020_5/2020/10/09/03-33-24-280_e2895be80f2b6302.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9a/Eat-Healthy-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-11-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn55@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-27-437_b2f936ade23c684f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cb/Eat-Healthy-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-12-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn95@2020_2/2020/10/09/03-33-20-414_a2debc59880ab0ce.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/03/Eat-Healthy-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-13-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn48@2020_1/2020/10/09/03-33-20-300_d04ffb702ed5845e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/da/Eat-Healthy-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-14-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-25-779_f044c1f7621c6615.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0d/Eat-Healthy-Step-15.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-15.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn80@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-20-339_72f02d5b40dcfbc0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/87/Eat-Healthy-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-16-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn80@2020_6/2020/10/09/03-33-19-367_2651d82370bc6627.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/02/Eat-Healthy-Step-17.jpg/aid10794-v4-728px-Eat-Healthy-Step-17.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn18@2020_3/2020/10/09/03-33-25-392_63cda20d4ec5d7a2.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1f/Healthy-vs.-Unhealthy-Food-Choices_sample.png/340px-Healthy-vs.-Unhealthy-Food-Choices_sample.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn92@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-28-824_d5d00bd85aa9d4f4.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Healthy-Weekly-Meal-Plan_sample.png/340px-Healthy-Weekly-Meal-Plan_sample.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn27@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-23-252_fc3e8d496eeb34e1.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Healthy-Vegetarian-Weekly-Meal-Plan_sample.png/340px-Healthy-Vegetarian-Weekly-Meal-Plan_sample.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn76@2020_4/2020/10/09/03-33-21-202_97fdd4fb2d8e6091.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1602214380918},{"createdTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","updatedTime":"2020-10-09 11:33:00","title":"How to Replace Disc Brake Pads on a Bicycle","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Replacing worn out disc brake pads is an easy process that only requires some common tools and a few minutes of your time. Make sure you replace your disc brake pads whenever they get down to about 1-1.5 mm of pad. That way, you’ll avoid the risk of having the metal backing on the pads rubbing against your disc brake rotors and causing damage that’s more expensive to repair. Weak braking power or a high-pitched squealing noise when you brake in dry weather are also signs of disc brake pads that should be replaced. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Removing the Old Pads\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Removing-the-Old-Pads\">Removing the Old Pads</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Place your bike in a repair stand and remove the wheel. Mount your bike in a repair stand to elevate it and make it easier to take the wheel off and work on. Loosen the quick release lever by hand or use a wrench to take off the axle nuts that hold the wheel in place. Pull it off the fork to gain access to the disc brake caliper.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Replace Disc Brake Pads on a Bicycle Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle-Step-1.jpg/aid12149403-v4-728px-Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you don’t have access to a bike repair stand, carefully flip your bike upside down and balance it on the ground, so the wheels are in the air.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Pull out the retaining pin from the brake caliper by hand or using pliers. Bend the ends straight using needle-nose pliers and pull the pin out if your caliper uses a cotter pin. Remove the clip from the end of the pin, then unscrew the pin using an allen key or Torx screwdriver if the caliper uses a screw-in pin with a pin clip.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The caliper is the mechanism attached to the bottom of the axle on the side where the disc brake rotor, which is the disc itself, is attached to the wheel. When your wheel is on the bike, the caliper goes over the disc.</li> \n    <li>The retaining pin is a pin that runs horizontally across the disc brake caliper and holds the brake pads in place in the center of the caliper.</li> \n    <li>A cotter pin looks kind of like a bobby pin. It has a U-shaped bend at 1 end and the 2 opposite ends are bent in opposite directions to keep it in place. A screw-in clip-style pin just looks like a single pin and has a small roundish clip at the end it is inserted by.</li> \n    <li>Make sure you put this retaining pin somewhere where you won’t lose it so you can put it back when you’re done.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Push a flat-head screwdriver in between the pads and leverage them apart. Wedge the tip of a flat-head screwdriver into the crack between the brake pads in the center of the caliper. Move it back and forth a few times until you separate them all the way.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The brake pads are just 2 rectangular metal pieces with padding on the sides that face each other right in the middle of the caliper. There is a small crack between the padding where the disc brake rotor goes.</li> \n    <li>This resets the pistons so the new brake pads will fit properly inside the caliper.</li> \n    <li>Do not squeeze your brake levers at any point during this process or you will pop the pistons back out and the new brake pads won’t fit.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Pull the brake pads out by hand or with a pair of needle-nose pliers. Grab the pads between your fingers or in the jaws of a pair of needle-nose pliers. Pull them straight out and set them aside.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Some disc brake pads use a clip spring system to hold them in place. If you can’t pull the pads right out, try pushing them inwards to release the spring mechanism before you pull them out.</li> \n    <li>You might have to remove the outer pad first in order to pull certain types of disc brake pads out. If you can’t pull them both out at the same time, try this.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Installing New Pads\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Installing-New-Pads\">Installing New Pads</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Clean the inside of the brake caliper using degreaser spray and a paper towel. Spray some degreaser into the middle of the caliper to clean out dust, dirt, and other contaminant buildups. Wipe away the degreaser with a clean paper towel.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Any contaminants inside your brake caliper will transfer to your new brake pads, so it’s important to clean out the caliper first to keep the new pads working their best for as long as possible.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Put the new pads in the accompanying spring and squeeze them together. Line the U-shaped spring up with the grooves in the brake pads, so it is in between them and the pads are facing each other. Squeeze the pads together to sandwich the spring inside.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>On mechanical disc brakes, one brake pad sits right next to the motor and the other pad moves and squeezes it all together. You want the rotor to be really close to the stationary pad—not centered between the two pads.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Not all disc brake pads have a spring. Refer to your new brake pads’ instructions if you don’t see a spring.</li> \n    <li>It’s always a good idea to use new brake pads of the same brand as the brake caliper. Different brands may use different styles of pads, so they’re often not interchangeable.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Slide the brake pads into the caliper. Keep pinching the pads together and slide them into the center of the caliper. Push them all the way in until they are fully slotted into the caliper.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Some disc brake pads go in super smoothly and easily, while others might require more force to push them all the way in.</li> \n    <li>If your new pads just come with 2 pads and no spring, you might have to put the inner pad in first, then push the outer pad in to lock them in place.</li> \n    <li>It’s normal for the brake pads to be a little loose when you slide them into the caliper, so don’t worry if you notice this.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Insert the retaining pin back into the caliper. Push the pin all the way back in and bend the ends apart to lock it into place if it’s a cotter pin. Slide the pin in and tighten it using an allen key or Torx screwdriver, then slide the clip over the end if it’s a screw-in, clip-style pin.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Your new disc brake pads may come with a new retaining pin. If so, you can use this instead of the old pin if you prefer.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Put the wheel back on and spin it to check the caliper alignment. Put the wheel that you removed back into the fork and tighten the axle in place using the quick release lever or the axle nuts and a wrench. Give it a good spin and look closely at the disc brake rotor on the wheel to make sure it isn’t rubbing against the new brake pads.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Remember that the rotor is just the disc itself on the wheel. It goes in between the pads inside the caliper.</li> \n    <li>If the rotor is rubbing against the brake pads, adjust the caliper by loosening the caliper’s mounting bolts and realigning it until the disc rotor runs parallel to the new pads, then tighten the mounting bolts again.</li> \n    <li>Don’t squeeze the brake lever until you’re sure everything is aligned properly. If the disc is running straight and smooth, you can go ahead and squeeze the lever to pop the pistons out and make the new pads bite the wheel.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Ride your bike in a safe area and brake hard 10-20 times to bed in the pads. Take your bike down off the repair stand and bring it outside somewhere relatively flat and car-free. Ride around and squeeze the brakes hard 10-20 times until they feel like they’re working well and braking powerfully.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Replace Disc Brake Pads on a Bicycle Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e2/Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle-Step-10.jpg/aid12149403-v4-728px-Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You’ll notice that the brakes feel stronger each time you pull them while you’re doing this process. Once you don’t notice any more changes in how powerfully they’re working, you can ride your bike as normal.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>The process for changing disc brake pads is the same for both road bikes and mountain bikes.</li> \n  <li>There are various styles of disc brake calipers and pads, so always refer to the manufacturer’s instructions for the exact installation method. The general process is the same, but there might be something slightly different that locks them into place.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Don’t ride your bike as you normally would until you bed in the new disc brake pads in a safe area because they won’t work at full power at first.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Things You’ll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You’ll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.E2.80.99ll-Need\">Things You’ll Need</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>New brake pads</li> \n  <li>Allen keys</li> \n  <li>Flat-head screwdriver</li> \n  <li>Needle-nose pliers (optional)</li> \n  <li>Torx screwdriver (optional)</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Replace-Disc-Brake-Pads-on-a-Bicycle#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\"
